story:
Serving Beyond Borders


Experiences That Have Shaped Me:

I have served on student councils since sixth grade, with a year as vice-president of our City-Wide Student Government, and participated in statewide Model UN and Model Assembly Programs. I also had the opportunity, through a Minneapolis work training program, to apply for and be accepted as an intern for U.S. Congressman Keith Ellison last summer. That experience gave me an inside look at the American political system.  I have overcome challenges and grown along the way - with the divorce of my parents several years ago, and with my dyslexia bringing myself to an A/B average in school.

I work at a popular community movie theatre, have saved money since I was very young and used much of it to invest in the stock market. I am also in the process of selling most of that to help fund this exciting trip.

I have an optimistic and ambitious attitude toward life, and have a strong commitment to serving my community. I am also keenly interested in understanding the national and global challenges that face my generation now and in the decades to come. 


Why This Program is Important to Me:

The opportunity to work alongside farmers and community leaders, teachers, and medical workers [in Ecuador, Thailand, India, and South Africa] will bring an amazing service opportunity to exercise body, heart and mind.  Additionally, our interactive group study and learning will provide us with an understanding of these challenging global issues.


(For more details about the trip, click on the Updates tab above the video).


Your important contribution will support:

·  Hands-on service work with those who face these issues on a day to day basis.

·  Preparing me to offer more informed solutions to these pressing global issues.

·  A program preparing young leaders for our shared global future.

·   Making this amazing opportunity possible for me.


You may donate any amount you choose or pick from the Perks on the right.

Please help us get the word out  to anyone you think might be interested by using the Share Tools below the video.


                                   Thank you,

         For taking the time to visit my campaign.

                                         And,

           Thank you for your generous support!
story_txt:
Serving Beyond Borders 

Experiences That Have Shaped Me:
I have served on student councils
since sixth grade, with a year as vice-president of our City-Wide Student
Government, and participated in statewide Model UN and Model Assembly Programs. I also had the
opportunity, through a Minneapolis work training program, to apply for and be
accepted as an intern for U.S. Congressman Keith Ellison last summer. That
experience gave me an inside look at the American political system.  I have overcome challenges and grown along the way - with the divorce of
my parents several years ago, and with my dyslexia
bringing myself to an A/B average in school.I work at a popular community
movie theatre, have saved money since I was very young and used much of it to invest in the stock
market. I am also in the process of selling most of that to help fund this exciting trip.I have an optimistic and
ambitious attitude toward life, and have a strong commitment to serving my
community. I am also keenly interested in understanding the national and global challenges that
face my generation now and in the decades to come. 
Why This Program is Important to Me:


The opportunity to work
alongside farmers and community leaders, teachers, and medical workers [in
Ecuador, Thailand, India, and South Africa] will bring an amazing service
opportunity to exercise body, heart and mind.  Additionally, our interactive group study and
learning will provide us with an understanding of these
challenging global issues.(For more details about the trip, click on the Updates tab above the video).
Your important contribution will support:

·  Hands-on service work with those who face these issues on a day to day basis.·  Preparing me to offer more informed
solutions to these pressing global issues.
·  A
program preparing young leaders for our shared global future. 
·   Making this amazing opportunity possible for me.You may donate any amount you choose or pick from the Perks on the right.Please help us get the word out  to anyone you think might be interested by using the Share Tools below the video.                                   Thank you, 
         For taking the time to visit my campaign.
                                         And,           Thank you for your generous support!

story:
(See the English version below)

Qu'est ce que L'Académie Bouge & Boxe ?

L’Académie Bouge & Boxe est un centre d'entraînement d’excellence qui est en train de s'installer à Montréal. Les enfants, adolescents et adultes de tous les niveaux pourront y pratiquer plusieurs sports tels que la boxe, la Zumba, les arts martiaux mixtes, etc.

L'AB&B a choisi de s'impliquer positivement dans la communauté de Montréal-Nord, à travers des programmes qui favorisent le développement des enfants et adolescents : sport-études, camps d'été, activités sportives dans les écoles pour renforcer la persévérance scolaire, etc.

Ainsi, la mission de L’Académie Bouge & Boxe est de promouvoir des activités d’excellence dans les domaines sportif, culturel, de loisirs et de santé, auprès d’enfants, d’adolescents et d’adultes, tout en favorisant le développement psycho-social des jeunes et des familles.


Qui sommes-nous ?

Une équipe dynamique au service de la communauté!
Nous (Greg BAZILE et Sophia AZUR-BAZILE, co-fondateurs) avons une très grande expérience et sommes diplômés dans le domaine sportif et au niveau-psycho-social. Cela fait plus de 15 ans que nous travaillons auprès de jeunes et de familles en difficultés ; et ça fait plus de 20 ans que nous sommes impliqués au niveau sportif, ayant nous-même été des athlètes de compétition.
En plus d'être passionnés de sport et des entraîneurs certifiés, nous nous sommes entourés d'une équipe solide et dévouée, qui tient autant au développement sportif qu'à l'épanouissement des jeunes.
De plus, l'un de nos porte-parole, Georges LARAQUE, est très enthousiaste car il connaît les bénéfices du sport sur notre développement. Il fait du sport depuis son enfance et a joué à un niveau professionnel dans le hockey, notamment avec les Canadiens de Montréal.

Pourquoi vouloir nous impliquer en utilisant le sport ?

Dans ce projet, nous nous engageons à instaurer une démarche de mise en forme, de saines habitudes de vie (sportives et alimentaires notamment) et d’empowerment pour l’ensemble des citoyens de Montréal et ses environs.

Nous mettons donc en place des programmes de sport-étude et de persévérance scolaire, des camps d'été où les enfants pourront bouger et manger sainement!

Pour l'avoir nous-même vécu, nous savons à quel point le sport peut faire une différence positive dans la vie des jeunes. Nous avons plusieurs partenaires (écoles, organismes, police...) avec qui nous travaillons pour pouvoir favoriser l'épanouissement de plus de jeunes possible. Nous avons déjà commencé des activités avec eux et ils sont impatients de pouvoir participer aux programmes que nous pourrons mettre en place grâce à vous!


Est-ce que c'est important que vous participiez ?

Oui!! C'est essentiel! Grâce à vous, nous serons capable de rémunérer des entraîneurs qualifiés, d'acheter des équipements adaptés aux jeunes, ainsi que des boîtes à lunch et des collations santé et de leur offrir des activités qu'ils adoreront!

Votre contribution à la mise en place de L'Académie Bouge & Boxe nous permettra de faire un impact positif dans le développement de plus de 150 jeunes par année.


Participez à notre aventure et soyez récompensés!

Pour que nous soyons capables d'aider 150 jeunes à travers nos programmes, nous avons besoin de 100 000$.

Chaque dollar sera utilisé efficacement pour : rémunérer des entraîneurs et animateurs qualifiés ; acheter du matériel sportif adapté aux enfants et aux adolescents ; acheter des boîtes à lunch et des collations équilibrées ; offrir des activités ludiques et sportives ; tout cela pour la prochaine année.

Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif, nous ne pourrons pas aider autant de jeunes.

Et si nous dépassons notre objectif, les fonds supplémentaires seront appliqués à des programmes que nous mettrons en place l'été prochain.


Quel sont les bénéfices pour vous ?

Premièrement, vous aurez la grande satisfaction de contribuer au bonheur de nombreux jeunes, dont plusieurs feront connaître vos bienfaits, en représentant L'Académie Bouge & Boxe partout au Canada et à travers le monde, lors de compétitions et autres activités sportives.

Deuxièmement, vous aurez la gratitude de plus d'une centaine de jeunes à qui vous permettrez de pratiquer des sports et activités ludiques qu'ils aiment!

Hooo!! Et vous savez quoi ? On peut y ajouter du style et des récompenses! Nous avons des récompenses et des avantages super cools pour tous les niveaux de dons que vous ferez. Que vous donniez quelques dollars ou des sommes plus importantes, faites-vous plaisir!


L'impact!
Rappelez-vous que nos programmes aideront plus de 150 jeunes à s'épanouir. Ils représentent notre futur.
Contribuez et parlez-en autour de vous!! Parlez-en à vos amis, vos collègues, utilisez les outils de partage Indiegogo pour que nous fassions de ce projet un grand succès! 
MERCI!!! Nous apprécions sincèrement votre soutien!

ENGLISH VERSION

What is L'Académie Bouge & Boxe ?

L’Academie Bouge & Boxe is a training centre of excellence that is currently settling down in Montreal. Children, adolescents and adults of all levels will be able to practice several sports such as boxing, Zumba, mixed martial arts etc.

L’AB&B has chosen to positively get involved in the community of Montreal North, through programs that promote the development of children and adolescents: academic sport program, summer camps, sports activities in schools to increase school perseverance, etc.

The mission of l’Académie Bouge & Boxe is to promote sports, cultural, recreational and health activities with children, adolescents and adults, while promoting the psychosocial development of young population and families.

About us ?

A dynamic team serving the community!

We (Greg BAZILE and Sophia AZUR-BAZILE, co-founders) have extensive experience and are graduates in sport and the-psychosocial field. For over 15 years we work with youth and families in difficulty ; and it's been over 20 years that we are involved in sports, having ourselves been amateur and professional athletes.

In addition to being passionate about sport and being certified coaches, we are surrounded by a strong and dedicated team, which is as committed to promote sport development as youth development.

One of our spokespersons, Georges LARAQUE is excited because he knows the benefits of sport in our everyday development. He practices sport since childhood and played at a professional level in hockey,  in particular with the Montreal Canadiens  NHL hockey club.

Why using sports to reach the youth ?

In this project, we are committed to establish a process of training program, healthy lifestyle (sport and food in particular) and empowerment for all citizens of Montreal and its surroundings.

We are implementing academic sports and school perseverance programs, summer camps where children can move and eat healthy!

Having evolved in a similar structure, we know how sport can make a positive difference in the lives of young people. We have several partners (schools, organizations, police ...) with whom we work in order to encourage the development of more young people as possible. We have already started activities with them and they are excited to participate in programs that we will be able to put in place because of you!

How important is your participation ?

Essential!! Because of you, we will be able to hire qualified coaches, purchase suitable equipments for young people, as well as lunchboxes, healthy snacks and offer activities that they’ll love!

Your contribution to the establishment of L’Academie Bouge & Boxe will allow us to make a positive impact in the development of more than 150 youth per year.

Why join our adventure ?

To be able to help 150 youth through our programs, we need 100,000$.

Every dollar will be used effectively to : pay for qualified coaches and instructors; buy suitable sports equipments for children and adolescents; buy lunchboxes and healthy snacks ; provide recreational and sports activities; all this for the next year coming.

If we do not reach our goal, we won't be able to deliver our programs to as many youth.

And if we exceed our goal, the additional funds will be applied to programs we will put in place next summer. 

What do you get out of this ? 

First, you will have the overwhelming satisfaction of contributing to the happiness of many young people, many of whom will know your benefits, representing Move & Box Academy across Canada and around the world, in competitions and other sporting activities. 

Secondly, you'll get the gratitude of over a hundred young people who you allow to participate in sports and recreational activities they love! 

Ooh! And you know what ? We can add swag and rewards! We've got some very cool rewards and perks for every donation level you make. You can give a few dollars or larger amounts, have fun!

The Impact! 

Remember that our programs will help over 150 young people. They represent our future. 

Contribute and spread the word!! Tell your friends, family, and co-workers about our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools to make this project a great success!

THANK YOU!!! We really appreciate your support!

story:
Sam Sticks It to Cancer (by helping her raise $6650)!

Sam is already a success. An all-round fantastic person, friend, girlfriend and colleague, she’s overcome the challenges of growing up in the foster-care system, graduated university and now works to make things better for kids who have also grown up without their families. As her friend, I’ve admired her strength and spirit, and how well she can overcome anything that gets in her way. This is what makes her recent cancer diagnosis so difficult to fathom.  It’s just so strange to see her face something she can’t fix—at least, not without some help.

Sam has an extremely rare malignant brain tumor, which she discovered after experiencing sudden blurry vision. There is a precise, medical term for it (“Intracranial Chondrosarcoma”); basically she’s got a big, scary, jerk of a lump lodged between a rock, a hard place and her near her brain stem, and she needs surgery and radiation ASAP. Because of its serious nature, Sam’s surgery has been fast-tracked and will be scheduled for June 10 (her brain surgeon normally has a 2 year waiting list).

Where we come in:

Thankfully, the wonderful Canadian medical system will cover the surgery, but because of it’s tricky location near the brain stem, the surgeon won’t be able to get it all out and she’ll need special radiation treatment. Her type of tumor is so rare that she’ll need to relocate California for a month to receive special proton radiation therapy. Travel, accommodation and medication (in addition to hefty, on-going student loan payments and rent) all add up to much, much more than someone on unpaid medical leave from a non-profit job can afford—especially someone who doesn’t have the support that many of us can look to during health crises.

I believe Sam will be successful with this treatment—the prognosis is good with proton radiation, and it’s just not Sam’s style not to be. The difficult reality is that, without a little help, this treatment will not be possible.

What can you do?

1.  Share this page (it’s free!): the more shares that her profile gets the higher up she moves on the website. So when people are looking to donate to a cause they will see Sam’s profile and give her all the money!

2.  Share your paycheck!: If you have the means—whether $5 or $500—every bit you can contribute will help make this very necessary treatment a reality.

3.  Share Sam’s story with your community!: Whether your community means sports teams, religious affiliations or coworkers, tell them how awesome Sam is and how donating even $2-$5 could be life altering for Sam (literally).

Join us as we all help Sam show this big, scary jerk of a lump who’s boss.

With love and gratitude,

Lisa & Friends

Expense Breakdown*:

$2600: 5 Weeks Accommodation in Loma Linda, California

$1800: 3 months of student loan payments

$1600: Flights for Sam and her Support/Hug-purveyor/Cheerer-upper

$650: 5 Weeks Car Rental

*Sam will have access to modest medical disability, so food, gas, parking and other incidentals are affordable. She's also planning to do some local fundraising to offset any costs that aren't fundraised here. 

More Info on the Big, Scary Jerk-of-a-Lump:

Sam has an extremely rare, malignant tumor called an “Intracranial Chondrosarcoma”. These count for 0.15% of all brain tumors. Roughly 1 out of every 3,500,000 people will ever be diagnosed with one. Because the tumor is so close to her brain stem, carotid artery and is pressing on her optical and hearing nerves they won't be able to take it all out. That’s why she needs the specialized radiation treatment – to take care of the small amount that will be left in after surgery.

Note from Sam:

First of all - a big thank you to everyone who has helped or offered to help in the last month and a half since I started seeing double.  I appreciate all the well wishes and on-going support. 

If you would like to stay up to date on my progress check out my blog at http://sampothier.wordpress.com/

story:
Short Summary

Brief History of St. Paul Saturdays

  

Dr. William J. Harrison, Co-Founder

Bishop C. Garnett Henning, Co-Founder & Former Pastor of St. Paul A.M.E.

In 1984, after a passionate discussion between Dr. William J. Harrison, a prominent educator, and Bishop C. Garnett Henning, pastor of St. Paul A.M.E. Church, about the need for a male mentoring program in the St. Louis area, Saint Paul Saturdays was established in the basement of St. Paul A.M.E. Church. St. Paul Saturdays was founded by Dr. William J. Harrison, an educator, historian, humanitarian, and active member of St. Paul A.M.E. Church and Bishop C. Garnett Henning. Dr. Harrison, who died in June, 1994, and Bishop C. Garnett Henning strongly believed that young black men, need, desire, and deserve a chance in life. 

From our humble beginnings of 12 charter members 30 years ago we have grown to more than 50 young men (ages 6 to 17) each Saturday. Each young man understands he is expected to earn a college degree. We have partnered with Washington University and other local universities to provide tutoring to each young man every month, along with other meaningful support. The program has a 100% high school graduation and college attendance rate.

Fundamentally, St. Paul Saturdays is a community program with no religious affiliation requirements for young men to participate. There is no cost to participate.


St. Paul Saturdays visits Lincoln University in Jefferson City, MO!


St. Paul Saturdays visits Central High School in Little Rock, AR!

The Annual Summer College Tour is our culminating event for the year!

  • Each young man must write a thoughtful reflection about their past school year performance in order to attend.
  • Upon returning from the trip, each young man will write a reflection about the history of the colleges we visit.

  • We are taking our young men to visit: Kentucky State University, The University of Kentucky and The University of Louisville.


  • We will also visit cultural and historical landmarks such as: The Muhammad Ali Museum in Louisville and The Louisville Slugger Bat Factory and Museum.

  • We also plan to attend a Louisville Minor League baseball game to give the young men an opportunity to relax and unwind.

Essentially, we believe that if we expose our young African-American boys to college campuses at any age it will leave a positive impact on their life and show them where they can go with hard work and determination.

What We Need & What You Get

The Summer College Tour is our biggest field trip of the year to celebrate academic achievement at school and expound on our expectation for every young man to attend college after graduating from high school.

The $5000 we need will cover the basic costs as follows:

  • Roundtrip Charter Coach Bus
  • Hotel Accommodations for 2 nights in Kentucky
  • Food (Bus Snacks & Group Meals)
  • Historical, Cultural Landmark, and Sporting Event Admission Fees
  • Indiegogo Fees

We also have some great perks to offer for your generous donation! The perks vary depending on the amount given as seen on the right side of this page.

Our campaign will run for ONLY 30 Days! You can hold us accountable for your donations and see where your money is going - we'll keep you updated through trip photos and videos along our journey!


    The Impact

    "Young Black men — across the board — score below their counterparts in other racial and ethnic groups when it comes to graduation rates, literacy rates and college preparedness."(Source: http://www.pbs.org/wnet/tavissmiley/tsr/too-important-to-fail/fact-sheet-outcomes-for-young-black-men/)

    The Annual College Tour is our solution to this staggering problem. We believe early college exposure is a vital part of our young mens' development. 

    On the tour in they:

    • Experience what it feels like to be on a college campus.
    • Learn what they have to do to prepare themselves for college.

    100% of our young men, who stick with the program, graduate from high school and attend college. Since our founding in 1984, six St. Paul Saturdays Men have graduated cum laude ("with honors") from Morehouse College, Dr. Harrison's alma mater. 


    The People

    Co-Directors Jay Rhodes and Vincent Pierce

    Jay is a charter member of St. Paul Paul Saturdays and a 1992 graduate of Morehouse College with a degree in Finance. He genuinely cares about our youth and has a deep passion for helping them grow and develop into positive productive young men. He leads a team of men volunteers every Saturday in working with each member. 

    Vincent is an active member of St. Paul A.M.E. Church where the organization still meets. Vincent is proud graduate of Tuskegee University. Vincent has worked with the young men of St. Paul Saturdays for over 20 years. He's an active member of the greater St. Louis community working on committees that focus economic development and political empowerment.


    Run and Tell Somebody!

    Even if you can't help with funding our trip, we would be very grateful if you spread the word about our campaign to anyone you know who believes in youth empowerment, education, manhood, leadership and development! Thank you for your time! All the best!

    * Your donation will be 100% tax deductible. St. Paul Saturdays is a federally chartered 501-c(3) not for profit organization.

between Dr. William J. Harrison, a prominent
educator, and Bishop C. Garnett Henning, pastor
of St. Paul A.M.E. Church, about the need for
a male mentoring program in the St. Louis
area, Saint Paul Saturdays was established in
the basement of St. Paul A.M.E. Church. St. Paul Saturdays was founded by
Dr. William J. Harrison, an educator, historian,
humanitarian, and active member of St. Paul
A.M.E. Church and Bishop C. Garnett Henning.
Dr. Harrison, who died in June, 1994, and
Bishop C. Garnett Henning strongly believed
that young black men, need, desire, and
deserve a chance in life. 




From our humble beginnings of 12 charter
members 30 years ago we have grown
to more than 50 young men (ages 6 to 17)
each Saturday. Each young man understands he is
expected to earn a college degree. We have
partnered with Washington University and
other local universities to provide tutoring
to each young man every month, along with
other meaningful support. The program has
a 100% high school graduation and college attendance rate.

is a community program with no religious
affiliation requirements for young men to
participate. story:
I have been given the opportunity to study abroad at the University of Otago next Fall!  I cannot wait to continue to explore my passion in international studies and leadership. I will be studying during my time in NZ, but I felt that I needed to do more! Therefore, I have partnered with several professors and the Gilman Foundation to host a service project during my time! 

  • During my time at New Zealand I will . . . 
  • Take several classes in international relations and global security
  • Implement a pin-pal program with New Zealand students and high schoolers in the United States to discuss international policy and learn about new cultures
  • Blog about my adventures and share with other students to inspire them to study abroad too!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • During my time in New Zealand I will not be able to work (I can only obtain a Student Visa) and I plan to use my funds for the service project, and other scholastic expenses. Every little bit helps!
  • I will blog- post pictures, journal, and take videos so that you can follow me during my travels!

The Impact

  • This project is important to me for sevearl reasons. First, it is the first time I have been away from my family for an extended period of time. I am nervous about the longevity of my program, but I am eager to experience a new culture and study in an entirely different part of the world.
  • I am graduating in only three years! Eek! This means that this will be my last requirement to fufill before I graudate and head to law school. I will take the LSAT in New Zealand and upon my return, graduate and enroll in law school. Stay Tuned.
  • Finally, my entire time at DU has been focused on foreign policy, global security threats, and globalization. I want to inspire other students to pursue thier studies from a different perspective. Through my service in New Zealand, I hope to foster meaninful converstaitons between young people with the intent to learn about culture and global affairs. I work with a group of students in Denver who may not have the opportunity to go abroad right away- I hope that my program opens thier eyes to a new way of thinking and motivates them to pursue thier collegiate dreams.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow my blog: ryleenz2014.tumblr.com 
  • Check in on my mom regularly- 6 months on the other side of the world is a LONG ways away!

Thank you all for your support- I feel incredibly blessed to be able to study abroad!!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tod Williams I have a strong background in the construction fields.  My wife Sheryl has life long ties to the Elmira community. Sheryl and myself want to educate the public and train individuals to install solar power systems.  

We are looking to crowdfunding to help us to reach our goal of building a Solar (PV) training facility.

With your help we will meet our goal and we will begin to educate the average home owner making a difference in the future path of many families power usage in our Community. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for 500,000 in funding,  We will use the funds for the building materials to construct our Solar Training Facility, including all the solar power systems needed to run our facilities. 

We will build the facilities ourselves and with the help from our community.  We will have free tours to educate the public, and workshops to train individuals to install Solar Power Systems for home, farm and small commercial installations.

We own a 11 acre lot that is currently farmed,  We will continue to farm 60% of the land the other 40% is designated for our training facilities, and homestead. 

If we do not meet our goal of 500,00 to complete our Elmira Solar Training Facility, we will use the funds to get one step closer to our goal.

The Impact

Your Contribution will help us so to educate the people in our community on the uses for Renewable energy. 

Your Contribution will help us to train individuals to install solar (PV) systems and teach them how to run their own solar (PV) system business in this rapidly growing industry.

Canada does not rank in the top 10 countries which use renewable energy sources, you will be helping to change this status and be making the world a better place.

We have contributed to three different Solar powered Crowdfunding campaigns in the past few months 

 >Solar Roadways

>Renewable Energy GEN

>Daymak Beast

Risks & Challenges

Me and my wife are very environmentally conservative people we will do everything necessary to achieve our goals. Our Community is behind us all the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

 Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help with our goals, Please share our posts talk to your friends about renewable energy and what we all can do to make our world a better place for generations to come. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Summary

The Sandhi Institute works with current and future leaders of all ethnic and religious communities in Sri Lanka (as well as other Asian countries) to heal past pain and to create a peaceful society. We teach communication and conflict resolution skills for individuals and groups using the Nonviolent Communication (NVC) process as developed by Marshall Rosenberg to move out of the cycle of violence - from victim, to perpetrator to victim.

We feel passionate about the impact our trainings make as expressed by a participant at a 10 day residential training in Sri Lanka

"I feel transformed. Now I can see the people from other ethnic groups with compassion, as human. I can see how they were suffering and were discriminated by the system. By talking about it openly (in NVC method), I learned to see them as human and to have understanding…” -

And by the coordinator of the youth from former war zones that attended their first training with us in 2011.

“What do you DO in your trainings? The change I saw in them after only ten days… the people I sent to you and the ones who came back were entirely different…. if we can do this with others in the community also, we can really make a difference here…”

We have been working with this group of youth for a few years, and they have a vision to bring these skills to others in their regions. This campaign builds on our previous work with the youth, and we are now raising funds to conduct a 6-day residential training for 40 youth. A third of the group will be the core group who will be supported on their track to become trainers, while the rest will get introduction to the communication process with lots of hands on, experiential practice and learning.

Your donation is important as it enables us to work in a way that can make real change happen. With donations like yours, more youth will be able to lead a life with safety, with a future, with a purpose.

What We Need & What You Get

You can sponsor one or more participants at the cost of $350 per participant (€ 260). Or give whatever amount you feel comfortable. If you choose to give a sponsorship as a gift to your loved one for the holidays, and if you wish it, give us their name and they will be included in the closing ceremony where we name all the people who have helped support the project.

Funds needed: $14,000 ( € 10300) to cover food and accommodation costs for participants, translators and trainers, (42 people), stationery and other organizing costs, local travel costs for participants, translators and trainers, airfare for trainers.

The trainers will be volunteering their time and have committed to coming even if it means covering their own costs, but we are aiming to raise enough to reimburse their costs after participants costs are covered.

In case we do not reach our goal we will run the workshop on a smaller scale.

Our Unique Strength

A key focus of all of our work is identifying what we need to do to move out of this cycle of violence ¬ from victim, to perpetrator to victim. What does it take to heal the wounds of being victimized, so that we can choose a different path as agents of our lives. A crucial first step in this process is being heard with a compassionate heart(s) and being acknowledged by others for one’s experience. In being heard in this way, people are able to move beyond victimization (NOT continue to be victims after the event in their thinking or their behavior).

The long standing experience of the Sandhi Institute and their trainers with the Nonviolent Communication process, as developed by Marshall Rosenberg,  supports skills building for individuals and groups who have the potential to transform themselves and affect/influence others by creating a safe, non-judgmental learning environment that models the process being taught.

The Impact

About half the group that attended our previous training now have made connections among the local authorities and identified individuals who are curious to know about NVC. Hence, they plan to invite few of these people to expose them to NVC so in the future, they will be able to get their support to conduct trainings within the communities. This kind of visionary thinking and leadership is exciting for us to see… coming from youth who were shell shocked and unable to speak up during small group sessions even only 3 years ago.

The coordinator of the organization, that sent them, said to us later in an awed hushed tone: “What do you DO in your trainings? The change I saw in them after only ten days!  The people I sent to you and the ones who came back were entirely different. If we can do this with others in the community also, we can really make a difference here…”

We feel very touched and impressed by the courage and strength they have found in each other and in the teachings we have offered.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your support to get the word out about this campaign. You can use your own or the Indiegogo share tools!
We also welcome creative ideas to support us with this specific campaign and with our work in Sri Lanka in general.

story:
My name is Oliver Macer and I'm 24 years old. At the end of March this year I had a serious snowboarding accident in the French Alps. As a result of the accident I broke 6 vertebrae, a handful of ribs, as well as puncturing a lung and suffering kidney contusions. After being air lifted and spending four days in intensive care in Grenoble CHU, I ended up being fitted with a custom-made torso brace, which I had to wear day and night for three months. I can honestly say that the whole experience has been the most traumatic of my life! 

On reflection, and as I continue my recovery, I consider myself extremely lucky not to have been left with any permanent damage. I feel genuinely blessed to be living a relatively pain free existence merely four and a half months after my accident. I awake each morning with a renewed sense of gratitude for all that surrounds me, and it is my strong intention to use the event of my accident as a gift. My experience has sparked an urgency to engage positively with the world and I wish to help those who surround me as well as those who don't. 

As a furthering step in my recovery and in the pursuit of my goal I have applied and been accepted onto a course called 'YIP'. YIP is an international Youth Initiative Program, based in Sweden, that helps to foster the initiative and entrepreneurial skills in young adults so that they can go out into the world and face some, or many, of the global challenges of our time. Since its inception seven years ago YIP has helped hundreds of young individuals recognise their true potential. It is a nine month long residential course that I am passionate about attending. Please find more information here: http://yip.se/about/

I wish to use 50% of the money I raise to fund my YIP experience, the other 50% I wish to donate to the Gloucestershire Royal Hospital Intensive care charity. Although I didn't use this particular unit, I did need intensive care treatment in France in the days after my accident, and I was blown away by how well trained the staff were, and how well they all coped in what is surely a very stressful work environment. They also helped me get back on my feet in those initial stages of recovery and I am eternally grateful for that. Without them and modern levels of care, the road to recovery would have been a much longer one. It is this department that I wish to donate to in order to further the incredible work they do... http://www.grhicucharity.co.uk/ 

Any contribution will be gratefully accepted and I cannot stress enough what a difference even the smallest donation will make. The course costs a touch over £7,500 and I have already managed to raise £4,000 through generous donations from my close family. As the course does not fall within the remits of standard educational funding, I am struggling to find the rest. I have set the target on this page at £6,000 and hope to use 50% of this for my course as previously stated, that means that I will hopefully raise £3,000 for the Intensive care charity. I'm sure this will be a massive help to the unit and will no doubt help others much like my self to make good progress in the initial stages of their recovery. Even if this target is not raised, I will stick to my plans of splitting whatever I manage to raise between the two causes. 

If you feel that you are not able to help financially, then please consider forwarding the link for my cause to whom you may feel it is appropriate.

Many, many thanks in advance.

Oliver :)

The course costs a touch over £7,500 and I have already managed to raise £4,000 through generous donations from my close family. As the course does not fall within the remits of standard educational funding, I am struggling to find the rest. I have set the target on this page at £6,000 and hope to use 50% of this for my course as previously stated, that means that I will hopefully raise £3,000 for the Intensive care charity. I'm sure this will be a massive help to the unit and will no doubt help others much like my self to make good progress in the initial stages of their recovery. Even if this target is not raised, I will stick to my plans of splitting whatever I manage to raise between the two causes. 
If you feel that you are not able to help financially, then please consider forwarding the link for my cause to whom you may feel it is appropriate.
Many, many thanks in advance.
Oliver :)

story:
What is Camp Quest?

Camp Quest is a national non-profit organization committed to providing an educational adventure shaped by fun, friends and freethought, featuring science, natural wonder and humanist values.

Camp Quest envisions a world in which children grow up exploring, thinking for themselves, connecting with their communities, and acting to make the most of life for themselves and others.

Every staff member attending camp is an unpaid volunteer. This means that 100% of your donation goes toward increasing the size of our camp and giving the opportunity to attend camp to even more kids!

Camp Quest Ohio offers a week-long, secular, summer camp experience to campers between the ages of 8 and 17. From humble beginnings with fewer than 10 campers, we have grown each year. In 2013, we reached the limit of our facilities with nearly 100 campers. In order to serve a greater number of families, we're going to expand to two weeks in 2015!  We've also received a fourteen financial aid requests this year, totaling almost $6,500. While we do whatever we can to make sure interested campers are able to attend Camp Quest Ohio, this amount of financial aid requests depletes the amount we can set aside for expanding our camp. For this reason it's even more important for us to raise awareness of our organization.


What We Need to Expand

Camp Quest Ohio estimates that in order to expand to two weeks we need to raise $12,000 this year.

Your donations will help us:
  • Reserve our spot with our host facilities for a second week.
  • Recruit and train 20 new staff members.
  • Provide financial aid for families who aren't able to afford the entire cost of camp.
  • Cover other expenses associated with doubling our capacity, such as a canoe trip and camp t-shirts.


The Impact

By reaching our ultimate fundraising goal of $12,000 we will be able to share the camp experience with twice the number of campers. We've also received nearly $6,500 in financial aid requests this year. With your donation we'll be able to meet these requests and not be forced to turn campers away due to their family finances. Our campers are making tangible contributions to society and by expanding our services we will make an even larger positive impact on society.


More Information

If you'd like to find out more information about Camp Quest Ohio, please visit our website: http://ohio.campquest.org/ You can also donate through our website.

Camp Quest is a national organization and there are camps all over the United States, if you're interested in learning more their website is: http://www.campquest.org/

If your donation qualifies for a Camp Quest T-shirt, one of our campaign organizers will contact you for your t-shirt size.

story:
Thank you for visiting my page. I included more information about me, the progran and how you can help in a presentation on prezi: http://prezi.com/ohgoamia-dll/support-the-learning-journey-of-a-social-entrepreneur/

 

About me...

My name is Dina Amiri, I applied Warriors Without Weapons and was ecstatic when I was accepted to participate with 49 other young people from around the globe, after a one month long selection process. What I have found special about this program is that it gets the participants to put their hands to work to make a collective dream of a better world a reality in 30 days!

Brazil is a country that have undergone profound changes such as the consolidation of the democratic process, sound economic performance and the promotion of social justice.
Tolerance, acceptance of differences, and respect of the other are values that I have sensed in an earlier short visit to the country. I will be back with lots of information and experiences to share.

What I do see myself as, is someone who’s informed, committed, passionate and willing to take risks.   

The Impact

If I was to be able to pay the entirety of the costs for the program, that would not only ensure the confirmation of my going, but also allow the Elos Institute in assisting others around the world who are unable to obtain the financial resources. The 50 of us accepted to this program are using a cooperative model of fundraising, meaning if we aren’t able to raise enough or we raise more than we need, all extra money is given for our fellow Warriors who are struggling, don’t have the socio-economic context from which to be able to easily run a fundraising campaign, or any other reason. The rule of thumb is; if you're passionately committed to going, you will.

I am planning to transfer the knowledge to the growing network of social entrepreneurs graduated and attending Namaa School for Sustainable Development. It's expected to reach 300 youth by the end of the year. And we will then move to impact communities in different places around Egypt and create spots of light. May be this could be how will be how we will realize our bigger dream of a better Egypt. And instead of more people leaving the country each day we will have friends and family back.

This is my dream...

http://amirigsa2012.blogspot.com/2012/06/blog-post.html

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are in Egypt, please segregate your waste and give me your non – organic waste (plastic bottles, aluminum, tin, and paper). Do not throw anything.

Please flow this link to fill the form: fill the form below:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/viewform?formkey=dDFhLXdRVjhiSklNa0FJYlYzOEY3OEE6MQ

Every body please Send a personalized email to 10 of your most intimate friends and family and share this page, and my personal blog for more information.  If you are really feeling inspired to be into action, as I am, call one person and have a conversation with them about a $1-$100 donation that they can make as a gift to support 50 young people getting to Brazil for a transformative 30 days.

Don’t forget about the Share Tools that make it super easy to get the word spread online!

story:
About this project

So here is the deal, we have all been in the position of a tourist once in our lives. Whether its the town next door or a country half way around the world we all know what its like to be out of our element from time to time. Most people think being out of your element is a bit of a uneasy feeling but there is always an upside. As a tourist we are granted with the ability to leave. If you don't like the weather you leave. If you don't like the food you leave. If you don't like the color of the sheets in your hotel room you can leave. Its amazing the power we have as tourists!

This is where the name for this project comes in, Namaste Child. Namaste in its literal translation from Sanskrit means "Bow-I-You" or "I bow to you" but it is normally used as a greeting or a farewell. When examining the idea of tourism and our ability to impact those in the world around us I found that the name has a very profound meaning. When you see an individual in need along your journey you greet them, interact with them, say your farewells and then they are gone. Only to exist in your memory. But why doesn't the desire for action extend itself beyond that brief moment?

My project Namaste Child is focused on extending the experiences of my trip to India into action. Upon my arrival in India I will focus my camera on the ever growing issue of the homeless and impoverished street children. It is an epidemic that is the largest incident of neglect in the world. With India's population being 1.2 billion strong and having tripled in the past 50 years it is no wonder this issue has yet to slow down. There are currently approximately 15-18 million street children fending for themselves on the streets of India. Organizations like i-India, Hope Child, and Smile Foundation, just to name a few are working diligently on fixing this issue but they can always use some support. 

Here is my contribution. I am heading to India in May until the money I bring with me runs out. I will be working my way from the southwest state of Kerala up to the northeast corner of Kolkata and then west to Delhi through the major problem area of Jaipur. I will have my camera on me at all time documenting my travels and experiences. I will be seeking out the experience of the daily lives of the locals with a keen focus on the children. After I am thoroughly exhausted I will sadly leave the beautiful country of India but unlike most tourists my contribution to the country will not end there.

With the images I bring back from my trip I will work tirelessly to put together a gallery showing of my images. Working to get some sponsors to help with the expenses, I will be selling prints and accepting donations for the cause. In addition to the gallery a website will be created to showcase the work and display all the supporters names. Each supporter who donates $100 or more will be recognized on the Namaste Child website. With all the money coming from print sales and donations, 100% of the profits will go to an active organization benefiting the children. I am currently narrowing down a non-profit group working in India to donate the proceeds of this project to. If you have any suggestions I will gladly take nominations.

Lets get down to the breakdown, this is what I am asking you to assist this project with. While I have already self funded and booked the flight and have flexible departure and return dates, there is still so much to do and here is what I need:

Accommodations

Extra Photography Rentals

Food Expenses

Transportation Expenses (Train, Rickshaw, Buses)

Gallery Funding

I am going to be running this project on a pretty tight budget but with your help I can make it happen and give back. Through my efforts we all can do our part in putting a stop to this graphic and inhumane epidemic. Please help me not just leave this trip with a farewell "namaste", but to extend our contribution beyond the average tourist.  

Namaste,

story:
Our Story

We are Cody & Alyssa Cook, two teenagers from Texas, and we have been given the opportunity to spend part of our summer doing mission work through our local church youth group with a community of children in El Salvador. Two years ago we took a trip to Monterrey Mexico with this same group, and we can not wait to do it again! We hope that you will help us raise the money to get there! 


Please watch this video from a previous Mission trip to El Salvador, we hope that it helps you see why we can't wait to go.


Photos from Previous AIM Trip to Mexico.




The Impact

The impact that this trip has on our personal lives is phenomenal! Having the opportunity to share happiness, candy, toys, and perform various plays, music videos, and give hugs to all the kids just opens our hearts to the commmunity... the world. Spending time with those that are less fortunate, giving of our time, and our efforts, it really puts into perspective what our priorities in life should be. We appreciate what we have more. And our heart is more open to those in need. 


The impact on the kids, and the lives of those in the community is that we show them Jesus' love working through us. We show them that they matter to us, and to God. That we took a week out of our summer to spend here working with them, helping them, entertaining them... in hopes that it will directly impact someone, if only one person.. it will be worth it.


We will be traveling with the AIM (Ambassadors in Missions) Group in the North Texas District. AIMers team with nationals under the direction of King's Castle Ministries and train to perform human videos and dramas for school assemblies and street ministry. This is an intense opportunity to reach hundreds for the Kingdom of God. 


We believe in this project, and we even asked our mom to change our cruise to Italy so we could go on this trip instead, that's how important this trip is for both of us. 





What We Need & What You Get

This trip costs $1500 per person. This includes airfare, lodging & food while there. We will be staying in a local village and will be walking nearly a mile back and forth every day carrying all of our equipment to the location. We have already started our weekly training to prepare for the trip. We are working with our youth group to raise funding as well, if we surpass our goal, all additional funds will be donated towards another person who needs to help fund their trip.


Our

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pray for us and our team as we go over there to serve and minister to these children and families. Pray for our health, safety, and that our hearts will be broken and used to bring light into a dark world.

Please share this with others, and help us spread the word, we only have a short time to come up with the money.


It's been said that for every dollar you invest, it allows you to reach one soul for christ. Please prayerfully consider making a donation towards our goal.


Thank you, from the bottom of our hearts! 

Cody & Alyssa Cook

& Parent Katrina Cook

& Grandmother Carolyn Saylors

story:
A Celebration of Women™ is honored to share with the Women of our World just 'one' of our application letters that arrive to our mail. We are preparing for our global launch of safe houses and educational units within our Alumni of WOMEN of ACTION™, and their territories. Many of the targeted areas we are working to help are outside the reach of present day zones being assisted.

BELOW is one story:

For me, the most important way I learn is traveling to rural areas and listening to the women and girls who are struggling against great odds to give their children the chance at a better life. A few months ago, I was in Rural Tanzania 377 Km from the Capital City where I met a young mother named Ogo Ogola aged 29. She has five children now and she is now a widow, didn’t go to school neither her children until now. She want to develop her self, but she has no any mean, capital neither knowledge on how to start.

Every time I come back from a trip, I am overflowing with stories about why women like Ogo are so inspiring to me to go extra far looking for ways to assist back. By meeting people on the ground, I also get to see first-hand how the theme of MCHEEO, the role of measurement in improving delivery, can help poor women/ girls serve people’s needs.

Below are pictures of our recent project to the needy suffering community in Tanzania organized by MCHEEO in collaboration with friends of the organization who are students from Europe.

 

Few of Journalism from Tanzania media and radio interview me.

Inside house of Ogo, below are few of her utensil and cooking stove.

One of the friend of MCHEEO talking to Ogo's Mother.

Shopping center around the place.

Canteen area.

Distribution of basic need to the suffering by our representation.

Geofry R Celebration House, Tanzania 03/01/2013
As you wait for more details from us, please do visit this page and you will see one among the charitable activities we do to suffering community. http://www.facebook.com/pages/GlobusHamburg/246...

Actions

Geofry R Celebration House™, Tanzania
Catherine Anne Clark, Founder & CEO

"I have seen in your website that “ A Celebration of Women™ is having another incredibly successful year, thanks to all of the hard work by you and your teams.”

“Your focus and dedication to make the world a better place for women/girls is what makes A Celebration of Women™ such an incredible and an exemplary organization, and one that MCHEEO aspires to work with. I am thankful for the quick respond of our mail, and I together with the board of directors are so excited about working together with your Organization, soon we are going to grow in areas we never thought possible reaching women/girls in deep rural areas of Tanzania , we have a lot to be thankful for one of them is accepting our request for partnership".

Catherine, we will soon send you our organization's manifestation with photos as requester by your organization. We are calling for an extraordinary meeting of the board of directors to work on the issue of expense proposal for a starter home inside Tanzania. we will get back to you soon on this.

In the first place, we would like to express our gratitude from the board of directors of MCHEEO for willing to work with us. It is gratifying to know that you Organisation have shown an interest in working with MCHEEO. Please accept, Catherine, the assurance of our highest esteem.

There are three compelling reasons why we choose to work for women/girls. First, we never forget where we all came from because we all came from rural areas. It’s safe to say that none of us want to see our women suffering.

And second, we don’t ever want to forget were we came from so we join our hands together as University scholar to find/look for solution. When we flash forward we all see of the wonderful positive changes and people that make up this great family of developed women/girls.

And third, to remind us all that Thanksgiving to our women for all they surrender to make us successful University graduands. its a time to reflect on all of the good in our lives. We all have stresses and challenges however this day is for setting that all aside and to consider all of the blessings we have – our families, friends, co-workers and the pivotal moments that make up our life. It is also a time to send good thoughts out to the women and girls in our rural communities who keep us all safe.

Your Sincerely
Geofrey L Rucho
Founder& General Secretary.

Mother and Child Hope for Education and Empowerment Organization
mkwepu street/sokoine Drive
Exporters bulding 1st fl.Rm #2
Adjacent to Habari Corporation
P.O.Box 34476 kijitonyama Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
+255785 868714/+255716 441 436/
Email:ruraltanzania@hotmail.com/ geofreyrucho@yahoo.com

Our media center in Toronto, Canada will establish a full-time online crew that will be expanding our reach, elevating the global Awareness of Celebration House™ and our partners that are out there waiting for our help - your help. Take Action, please.

 

HELP US TO HELP THEM !!!

 

  A Celebration of Women™

presents our

PINK DAY 2013 COMMITTEE CHAIR - REV. SKY STARR 

 

PINK DAY 2013 - OCTOBER 24, 2013

TORONTO ARGONAUTS FOOTBALL CLUB celebrates PINK DAY annually offering one game a year dedicated to raising funds for the CANADIAN BREAST CANCER FOUNDATION.

ENJOY VIDEO: http://cfl.ca/video/index/id/87469  

Our Global Alumni WOMEN of ACTION™ are joyously hosting the 2nd Annual Celebration of Cancer Survivors VIP Event, this year inside the Window's Room at the ROGERS CENTER - TORONTO, CANADA.  

SUPPORT A GREAT CAUSE - BUY YOUR TICKET TODAY ! 

DONATE $100 = I VIP TICKET PASS INTO THIS AMAZING EVENT!

 

She is also TOP 50 in CANADA VOLUNTEERS !!! 

Rev. Sky Starr lives in the Jane/Finch corridor, a troubled neighbourhood that sees frequent gang-related shootings and stabbings. Rev. Starr recognized that violence has left her community in a constant state of grief--so she got trained in grief counselling. Her goal is to help heal her neighbours and friends, because she says, "there's a need, so I serve. It is in me."

In 2007, Starr started Out of Bounds, a grief support organization that has so far helped over 5,000 people deal with the aftermath of violence. Starr provides non-denominational support and operates out of space donated by the Catholic School Board. 

Started the program in the community, volunteer based program. Starr has recruited and trained over 20 volunteers, from all walks of life. Phil Edwards, an outreach worker for the City of Toronto says Starr is an "icon" and is the first person who has helped people in the Jane/Finch community deal with grief on such an organized scale.

*** % PROCEEDS INSIDE WINDOW'S ROOM go to Out of Bounds, as beneficiary of Celebration House™. 


HOW YOU CAN HELP: FURTHER INFORMATION AND LINKS

Visit the Out of Bounds website at:
http://outofboundsjf.org/

Learn about Rev. Starr's other project Fathers Across Cultures:
http://www.fathersac.org/

ADDITIONAL MEDIA

READ MORE: http://bit.ly/14An9Pl  

WATCH VIDEO : http://bit.ly/13QlcI6  

“I AM a WOMAN of ACTION™ BECAUSE …”, Global Alumni 2013

Cybill graduated with High Distinction (Suma Cum Laude) from the University of Toronto, where she received a BBA degree with a focus on Finance and Strategic Management.

She continues to remain active as an alumna and has participated in speaking engagements, video interviews and is spotlighted in various U of T magazines.

In Toronto, she worked with the commercial lending and mid-market investment banking group at CIBC for media and technology companies across Canada and was a Venture Capital Associate for a technology-focused venture capital firm, KBL Capital.

DONATION GIFTS BELOW: 

  • DONATE $25 - This marvelous 100% COTTON T-SHIRT is our appreciation to YOU!  This Awesome T is a true sign of support.
  • DONATE $100 and if in TORONTO, VIP TICKET into PINK DAY 2013, an amazing Football Game (ARGOS wearing pink & raising funds for the Canadian Breast Cancer Foundation) as well as, our 2nd Annual A Celebration of Cancer Survivors Event at Rogers Center Window's Room, Toronto on Oct 24th, 2013 with a VIP PLATINUM entry Ticket to a Celebration Party and Speaker Event including LIVE entertainment, great food, prizes, auction, fashion show, and more ... you will remember always; as our token of appreciation for your supporting Celebration House™!

 

"Educate a Woman; Change the World" 

Celebration House™

A Celebration of Women™, a global not for profit that has been working for the education and empowerment of women since 2009. Team Celebration has built the global Alumni of WOMEN of ACTION™, housing hundreds of women leaders today on every continent. Our women leaders around the globe are ready, willing and able to assist us in the management of our educational residential safe houses, named: Celebration House™.

What We Need

  • We ask for your DONATION will assist us in setting up the infrastructure for a central nerve center, a media office operating for the express purpose of event planning, funding raising management, and the expansion of awareness for the building of safe houses around the globe; residential safe houses that will educate, heal and nurture new life into women that have been victimized by violence. 
  • We need your financial support as the ignition to the above mentioned central office/media center here in Canada so to create a physical and visible presence in our home based location; and act as your central head office for our global presence.
  • Our women do want a brainstorming space, one where they can expand services, expand their own respective missions, and collectively create.  Our 'virtual world' has expanded ... and ironically no calls for a physical space. WE envision all our 'actions' to be 'collective', so we invite you today to JOIN US and be part of a great cause. Once we establish our on-site social media team of educators, mentors and trainers, with management in one space, we will launch our online school, educating young women and girls globally.
  • We offer you this opportunity to support and become the ignition to the above mentioned central head quarters/media center here in Canada. Together we can create a physical and visible presence in our home based location; and act as your central head office for our global presence.

 

WE believe together we can contribute towards education of women and girls that will bring a change to our world.

ONE Idea!!   ONE mission!!!   "Educate and Empower Women/Girls!"

Help Educate at least One woman via #CelebrationHouse and Empower at least one girl/woman  PLease Take action now- ONE  DONATION is all we need from YOU!

What You Get

  • You will be welcome to visit and celebrate your name on our CELEBRATION WALL of DISTINCTION.  As part of this cornerstone, you will make a global statement that you are willing to Take Action and contribute in a cause towards the betterment of lives and education for all women and children.
  • You will be able to offer your services through our center, contribute suggestions, participate in our events, in person or online. 
  • You will become a change maker of opportunity to the youth of our society.
  • You will be able to monitor activity and accomplishments at this center as weekly news will be published on our website, audio, video and feature.

The Impact - Expanding Awareness and Services

Your participation/sponsorship is valuable to our world because once this central media center is opened, Team Celebration will offer space to seniors, university interns and college students who will in turn provide online education mentor programs for our women/children globally. All volunteers will also manage hotlines for women in crisis, expand awareness of our work online through upgrading our website tools for our readers globally. 

This physical presence and new action will manifest further public awareness of Celebration House™, enabling us to raise the final requirements to launch our global mission of one ‘safe house’ in each country suffering from serious violence against women, each in turn will educate, heal and graduate future women leaders, with a goal to house a physical presence on each continent by 2020.

“Educate a Woman, change the World”

We now must make a physical presence in our home city so to attract further support from sources in our world that ‘need’ the physical as motivation to participate. To-date, we have accumulated hundreds of member women leaders, all ready, willing to volunteer a service, an educational program, or offer volunteer virtual services or serve at events.

We have a Headquarters team of women here in Canada who will donate on site expertise. One central location will be established and used to collaborate and create further fund raising events and projects, manage our online education programs, offer in-house educational programs for women/girls.

We have partnered with some major local organizations and are in the planning stages of large events to raise further funding for the mission of healing women who are victims of serious violence; freeing children from human trafficking, and offering the residential safe house that will not only heal, but will educate, train and offer programs enabling self- sustainability for each and every resident.

Team Celebration has raised thousands of dollars for other charities through our event production, contributed great awareness of the requirement for 'investing in women' as one key solution in our world’s economic crisis.

100% of our activities are dedicated to one mission, to build ‘safe houses for young women’ who have been victims of violence, educating them and graduating future women leaders, named Celebration House™.

HOW DID THIS COME TO BE: A Message from the Founder

"I was requested to help one young woman to launch a women's empowerment magazine. When the cancellation of that launch occurred 18 months later, I found myself deep inside the world of women not being recognized for their diligence in the world of philanthropy, realizing there was a missing link for the collaboration of NGOs around the world.  

The levels of human indignity and suffering at the hands of sexual slavery, female mutilation, lack of education on a global level for women and girls opened my eyes to the fact that the women of our world must 'get organized' and truly start taking these issues more seriously from a grass root level, finding strength in unity; more importantly that the women leading this charge 'must be celebrated'.

Prompted by a vision, I created the first and only central stage that I named: The World Hub for Women Leaders that Care - an online platform that celebrates the lives, the woman and her work. Collectively, our women member leaders wish to educate girls around the globe, graduating future women leaders."

"I" turned into a "WE"

WE = The Collective Reflection of 'E'very 'W'oman!

The genesis of this central hub happened, a stage to Celebrate the Lives of our women leaders (philanthropic) that are Taking Action to create positive change in our world was born!

Noticing that women have not yet realized that for sustainable equity to be achieved,  'Equality of Women Amongst Women' must come first.

One central HUB was created for this purpose.  

As the awakening of the suffering, torture and violence that the women of our world are living with increased, my heart bled, my mind raced and my soul reached. Being educated to the fact that a great amount of this violence is managed by women against women, my heart broke.

When Women reflect as equals, global change will arrive!

Reaching all the women leaders who were devoting their lives to changing this horrific truth, and noticing that there was no central stage where they were being acknowledged, advocated or celebrated, A Celebration of Women™,  was born as the 'first central platform' to do just that!

Finding this void in our global structure, I decided to Take Action and create this central platform that would celebrate the Positive Action of women leaders - the unsung SHE-heros, those collectively working for positive change in the lives of all women and children. 

By 2011, the decision to take this vision to the next level occurred and application for charity approval was made in Canada and!  

Patent Letter approved , a new foundation was born in 2011!  

Upon this approval, the vision to build educational, residential safe houses was expanded, and we have not looked back since. 

Team Celebration invested every waking moment to this mission ever since, and have achieved the most amazing team of women leaders from all continents that contribute to this vision, as well.  

Our collective has a powerful positive butterfly effect!

If you are not in a position of offer any form of funding, we would love to hear from you anyway!  We are always seeking helpful souls with ability to appreciate our goal, ones who could offer some time in mentorship, spreading the news, or making suggestions on how we can reach our goals.

Help 'us' educate young women grow into future women leaders!

Join us in this celebration of women! Support us in our mission of educational and economic empowerment of women! Together we can contribute towards the progress of women and society at large by giving them the necessary skills, imparting them quality education and instilling in them the requisite amount of self-confidence for their effective participation in the developmental process which will bear fruits for generations to come!!

Engage with us, if WE strike a chord with YOU!

Your expertise is not to be wasted; please email our contact page at http://www.acelebrationofwomen.org/

If we do not reach our goal, these funds will be put into trust, until a collective of our campaigns will meet our goal.  *A statement from Indiegogo will be copied and published on our website, sans individual names at: http://www.acelebrationofwomen.org/ .

Thank you from Team Celebration (Some members listed below):

Catherine Anne Clark (Canada) , Camilla Stein (Netherlands), Shirlee Hall ( USA), Mary Moore (The Philippines), Randi Goodman (Canada), Tiffany Bond (Canada/Cancer Research), Dr. Phyliss Chesler ( USA/Harvard Women Issues), Joy Reyes (Dominican Rep.), Dr. Loretta Chen( Cambodia/Singapore), Jennifer Phillips(Board Member), Rosetta Stander (South Africa), Sharifa Sharif (Afghanistan), Jensine Larsen (World Pulse), Laura Farago, Ayi Jihu (China), Meetika Srivastava (India), Lorre White (USA), Princess Karina Bagration(RussianFederation/Switzerland), Ayumi Ueda (Japan - Women of the World), Giogia Renosto (Italy - Women of the World), Pilar Viviente (Spain), Jo Berry (Ireland), Ginger Katz (USA/Anti-Drugs), Sharon Love (Canada), Alenka Tercic (SLOVENIA), Cindy Stradling (Women's Shelters), Isabel Allende (Peru), Rachael Tengbom (Africa), Eve Ensler (Congo/ONE BILLION RISING-VDAY MOVEMENT), Angela DeMontigney (First Nations), Dilshad Deyani (World Women Global Council), Lynette Palmen (Australia), Ellen Voie (USA-Women's Trucking Assoc)  and the hundreds more of our Alumni members around the world!
story_txt:
A Celebration of Women™ is honored to share with the Women of our World just 'one' of our application letters that arrive to our mail. We are preparing for our global launch of safe houses and educational units within our Alumni of WOMEN of ACTION™, and their territories. Many of the targeted areas we are working to help are outside the reach of present day zones being assisted.
BELOW is one story:
For me, the most important way I learn is traveling to rural areas and listening to the women and girls who are struggling against great odds to give their children the chance at a better life. A few months ago, I was in Rural Tanzania 377 Km from the Capital City where I met a young mother named Ogo Ogola aged 29. She has five children now and she is now a widow, didn’t go to school neither her children until now. She want to develop her self, but she has no any mean, capital neither knowledge on how to start.
Every time I come back from a trip, I am overflowing with stories about why women like Ogo are so inspiring to me to go extra far looking for ways to assist back. By meeting people on the ground, I also get to see first-hand how the theme of MCHEEO, the role of measurement in improving delivery, can help poor women/ girls serve people’s needs.
Below are pictures of our recent project to the needy suffering community in Tanzania organized by MCHEEO in collaboration with friends of the organization who are students from Europe.
 

Few of Journalism from Tanzania media and radio interview me.

Inside house of Ogo, below are few of her utensil and cooking stove.

One of the friend of MCHEEO talking to Ogo's Mother.

Shopping center around the place.
Canteen area.
Distribution of basic need to the suffering by our representation.
Geofry R Celebration House, Tanzania 03/01/2013As you wait for more details from us, please do visit this page and you will see one among the charitable activities we do to suffering community. http://www.facebook.com/pages/GlobusHamburg/246...
Actions

Geofry R Celebration House™, TanzaniaCatherine Anne Clark, Founder & CEO

"I have seen in your website that “ A Celebration of Women™ is having another incredibly successful year, thanks to all of the hard work by you and your teams.”
“Your focus and dedication to make the world a better place for women/girls is what makes A Celebration of Women™ such an incredible and an exemplary organization, and one that MCHEEO aspires to work with. I am thankful for the quick respond of our mail, and I together with the board of directors are so excited about working together with your Organization, soon we are going to grow in areas we never thought possible reaching women/girls in deep rural areas of Tanzania , we have a lot to be thankful for one of them is accepting our request for partnership".

Catherine, we will soon send you our organization's manifestation with photos as requester by your organization. We are calling for an extraordinary meeting of the board of directors to work on the issue of expense proposal for a starter home inside Tanzania. we will get back to you soon on this.
In the first place, we would like to express our gratitude from the board of directors of MCHEEO for willing to work with us. It is gratifying to know that you Organisation have shown an interest in working with MCHEEO. Please accept, Catherine, the assurance of our highest esteem.
There are three compelling reasons why we choose to work for women/girls. First, we never forget where we all came from because we all came from rural areas. It’s safe to say that none of us want to see our women suffering.
And second, we don’t ever want to forget were we came from so we join our hands together as University scholar to find/look for solution. When we flash forward we all see of the wonderful positive changes and people that make up this great family of developed women/girls.
And third, to remind us all that Thanksgiving to our women for all they surrender to make us successful University graduands. its a time to reflect on all of the good in our lives. We all have stresses and challenges however this day is for setting that all aside and to consider all of the blessings we have – our families, friends, co-workers and the pivotal moments that make up our life. It is also a time to send good thoughts out to the women and girls in our rural communities who keep us all safe.
Your SincerelyGeofrey L RuchoFounder& General Secretary.

Our media center in Toronto, Canada will establish a full-time online crew that will be expanding our reach, elevating the global Awareness of Celebration House™ and our partners that are out there waiting for our help - your help. Take Action, please.

 
HELP US TO HELP THEM !!!
 
  A Celebration of Women™
presents our 
PINK DAY 2013 COMMITTEE CHAIR - REV. SKY STARR 
 
PINK DAY 2013 - OCTOBER 24, 2013
TORONTO ARGONAUTS FOOTBALL CLUB celebrates PINK DAY annually offering one game a year dedicated to raising funds for the CANADIAN BREAST CANCER FOUNDATION.
ENJOY VIDEO: http://cfl.ca/video/index/id/87469  
Our Global Alumni WOMEN of ACTION™ are joyously hosting the 2nd Annual Celebration of Cancer Survivors VIP Event, this year inside the Window's Room at the ROGERS CENTER - TORONTO, CANADA.  
SUPPORT A GREAT CAUSE - BUY YOUR TICKET TODAY ! 
DONATE $100 = I VIP TICKET PASS INTO THIS AMAZING EVENT!
 
She is also TOP 50 in CANADA VOLUNTEERS !!! 
Rev. Sky Starr lives in the Jane/Finch corridor, a troubled neighbourhood that sees frequent gang-related shootings and stabbings. Rev. Starr recognized that violence has left her community in a constant state of grief--so she got trained in grief counselling. Her goal is to help heal her neighbours and friends, because she says, "there's a need, so I serve. It is in me."
In 2007, Starr started Out of Bounds, a grief support organization that has so far helped over 5,000 people deal with the aftermath of violence. Starr provides non-denominational support and operates out of space donated by the Catholic School Board. Started the program in the community, volunteer based program. Starr has recruited and trained over 20 volunteers, from all walks of life. Phil Edwards, an outreach worker for the City of Toronto says Starr is an "icon" and is the first person who has helped people in the Jane/Finch community deal with grief on such an organized scale.

*** % PROCEEDS INSIDE WINDOW'S ROOM go to Out of Bounds, as beneficiary of Celebration House™. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP: FURTHER INFORMATION AND LINKSVisit the Out of Bounds website at:http://outofboundsjf.org/Learn about Rev. Starr's other project Fathers Across Cultures:http://www.fathersac.org/ADDITIONAL MEDIA
