The genesis of this central hub happened, a stage to Celebrate the Lives of our women leaders (philanthropic) that are Taking Action to create positive change in our world was born!
Noticing that women have not yet realized that for sustainable equity to be achieved,  'Equality of Women Amongst Women' must come first.
One central HUB was created for this purpose.  
As the awakening of the suffering, torture and violence that the women of our world are living with increased, my heart bled, my mind raced and my soul reached. Being educated to the fact that a great amount of this violence is managed by women against women, my heart broke.
When Women reflect as equals, global change will arrive!
Reaching all the women leaders who were devoting their lives to changing this horrific truth, and noticing that there was no central stage where they were being acknowledged, advocated or celebrated, A Celebration of Women™,  was born as the 'first central platform' to do just that!
Finding this void in our global structure, I decided to Take Action and create this central platform that would celebrate the Positive Action of women leaders - the unsung SHE-heros, those collectively working for positive change in the lives of all women and children. 
By 2011, the decision to take this vision to the next level occurred and application for charity approval was made in Canada and!  

Patent Letter approved , a new foundation was born in 2011!  
Upon this approval, the vision to build educational, residential safe houses was expanded, and we have not looked back since. 
Team Celebration invested every waking moment to this mission ever since, and have achieved the most amazing team of women leaders from all continents that contribute to this vision, as well.  
Our collective has a powerful positive butterfly effect!
If you are not in a position of offer any form of funding, we would love to hear from you anyway!  We are always seeking helpful souls with ability to appreciate our goal, ones who could offer some time in mentorship, spreading the news, or making suggestions on how we can reach our goals.
Help 'us' educate young women grow into future women leaders!
Join us in this celebration of women! Support us in our mission of educational and economic empowerment of women! Together we can contribute towards the progress of women and society at large by giving them the necessary skills, imparting them quality education and instilling in them the requisite amount of self-confidence for their effective participation in the developmental process which will bear fruits for generations to come!!
Engage with us, if WE strike a chord with YOU! 
Your expertise is not to be wasted; please email our contact page at http://www.acelebrationofwomen.org/
If we do not reach our goal, these funds will be put into trust, until a collective of our campaigns will meet our goal.  *A statement from Indiegogo will be copied and published on our website, sans individual names at: http://www.acelebrationofwomen.org/ .
Thank you from Team Celebration (Some members listed below):
Catherine Anne Clark (Canada) , Camilla Stein (Netherlands), Shirlee Hall ( USA), Mary Moore (The Philippines), Randi Goodman (Canada), Tiffany Bond (Canada/Cancer Research), Dr. Phyliss Chesler ( USA/Harvard Women Issues), Joy Reyes (Dominican Rep.), Dr. Loretta Chen( Cambodia/Singapore), Jennifer Phillips(Board Member), Rosetta Stander (South Africa), Sharifa Sharif (Afghanistan), Jensine Larsen (World Pulse), Laura Farago, Ayi Jihu (China), Meetika Srivastava (India), Lorre White (USA), Princess Karina Bagration(RussianFederation/Switzerland), Ayumi Ueda (Japan - Women of the World), Giogia Renosto (Italy - Women of the World), Pilar Viviente (Spain), Jo Berry (Ireland), Ginger Katz (USA/Anti-Drugs), Sharon Love (Canada), Alenka Tercic (SLOVENIA), Cindy Stradling (Women's Shelters), Isabel Allende (Peru), Rachael Tengbom (Africa), Eve Ensler (Congo/ONE BILLION RISING-VDAY MOVEMENT), Angela DeMontigney (First Nations), Dilshad Deyani (World Women Global Council), Lynette Palmen (Australia), Ellen Voie (USA-Women's Trucking Assoc)  and the hundreds more of our Alumni members around the world!

story:
Appalshop is a multi-media arts and cultural organization located in Whitesburg, Kentucky.  Its mission is to develop effective ways of using media to address the complex issues facing central Appalachia – a declining coal economy, a legacy of environmental damage, high unemployment rates, and poor educational opportunities and attainment.

In 1988, Appalshop staff members founded the Appalachian Media Institute (AMI), a multimedia training and leadership development program for central Appalachian youth.  Using the technological and artistic resources of Appalshop, AMI helps young people explore how media production skills can be used to ask, and begin to answer, critical questions about themselves and their communities.

To get the best sense of what we're all about, check out our online video gallery to view selections from the past 25 years!!

 

Each summer, AMI brings together twelve central Appalachian youth between the ages of 14 and 22 to participate in our Summer Documentary Institute.  By far our most expensive endeavor, we have estimated the total cost per individual to be $6,000 each.  This total includes:

Intern Stipend: $2,560
Media Training: $1,640
Equipment: $1,500
Program Management: $300

In addition, participants aged 16+ who complete the program will receive 3 hours of college credit in media production.

With your support, two AMI youth interns from the eastern Kentucky coalfields will receive media training in documentary video, leadership development, critical thinking skills, cultural awareness, media literacy, as well as increased college access.  Please help us reach our goal of $12,000.

For the past 25 years AMI has been providing an award winning, community-based media production and arts education program to youth from central Appalachia.  As the only program of its type in the region, AMI engages at-risk, low-income, rural youth in high quality arts education that they would not otherwise have access to in their struggling communities.

This region faces an exodus of young people, due in large part to the lack of economic and educational opportunities.  Youth have few avenues to participate in community decision-making, and even fewer opportunities to provide leadership in addressing the region’s critical issues, or creatively express themselves.  AMI creates a space for our interns to become community leaders through the practice of community art making.

story:
My name is Francisco Rodriguez and I am a MFA candidate at the Asolo Reperatory Theater for actor training. For those of you that don't know me, here's my artistic background:

I'm originally from Brownsville, Texas and I've been working in the theater for most of my adult life.  I graduated from the University of Texas in 2005 with a degree in Theatre and Dance and have had the opportunity to work with artists such as Robert Schenkkan, Jose Rivera, Paul Mullens and the NYC's Mabou Mines. In 2007, I won Austin's Artspark Festival award for creating/producing the most outstanding original work and cofounded a theater company, Debutantes & Vagabonds, in Austin, TX that same year.  In 2009 & 2010 I was awarded two Cultural Funding grants by the city of Austin to write and produce my plays.  In 2011, the Austin Theater Examiner nominated me for Best Director of a Drama. 

I have consistently kept working in the theater while still holding a day job and a sliver of a personal life. Recently, I was accepted into the British American Dramatic Academy's Summer Shakespeare session (BADA).

What I need help with is raising the money to fund my tuition.  The tuition is £3940, in dollars that translates to about $6,500.  Thankfully enough I've received a scholarship and I only need to pay $2000.

What's so great about BADA?

BADA provides classes M-F (9-5) throughout the month of July and well into August. Each week, students participate in scene study classes in Shakespeare and Modern text with additional classes in Voice, Movement, Audition Technique and Sonnets.  Each week I will attend two masterclasses taught by leading actors and directors of the stage and film.  No class has more than sixteen students.

These classes are taught by teachers such as:

John Barton: Co-founder of the Royal Shakespeare Company.

Sir Derek Jacobi: Founding company member of the National Theatre

Simon Callow: Famous for his roles in Titus Andronicus, Resistable Rise of Arturo Ui, As You Like it and Amadeus

James Bundy: Dean of the Yale School of Drama and Artistic Director of the Yale Repertory Theatre

Mark Wing-Davey: Head of the Graduate Acting Program at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts

Andrew Wade: Head of Voice at the Royal Shakespeare Company from 1990-2003

And many others:

http://www.badaonline.com/186/midsummer-in-oxford-program/masterclasses.html

Some exciting perks include:

$10-$20 Donate and I will record a "Thank you" video and upload it onto facebook and youtube, where I will personally thank you.

$21-60 You'll receive a postcard from whatever city in England I'm in.  It'll contain a personalized anecdote.

$61-$100 Receive a Funny or crazy picture of myself doing something in Europe.  Francisco kissing the Blarney Stone.  Francisco holding the Eiffel tower in his hand.  Francisco in a Lithuanian prison.  Collect them all!

$101-150 Receive an amazing drawing!  Francisco will draw a monument or a work of architecture for you.  Believe or not, he can draw.  And well.

$151-200 My travel blog!  Follow me and my adventures as I scavenge from city to city trying to make sense of a foreign land with strange ways.  If you'd prefer any of the other gift options let me know.  I can just as easily draw you a picture or send you a postcard!

$201 and above -  You get ALL the gift options!! It'll be your own personal Francisco travel adventure package.

You should definitely fund this project if you care about my education.  If you know me, you know I'm a very career driven and ambitious individual who plans on continuing to act and perfecting my art.  Wouldn't it be better if I knew what I was doing?!  Don't deny me the to opportunity to learn.  The world has enough terrible artists, don't let me be one of them!

Wait.  You want to do more?

Please post this on your facebook!  Got a twitter?  Twit away!  Annoy your friends with this.  I need you to do anything and everything to help me out.  In other words, make some noise!

*Disclaimer- Francisco does not approve of you doing ANYTHING but will probably approve of most things you do.

story:
Repost it, please!

 

Hi!

It is no secret, that Christmas is getting closer. And what is this, if not a magical time of a gifts? Remember, how you enjoyed your presents by your parents, grandmas and grandpas, uncles and aunts. Unfortantly, for most of us, this time is long in the past, but we beleive, that it is fundamentally wrong. Let’s try to budge situation and turn the world together!

We organize anonymous Santa’s club and invites everyone to participate in this. Let’s recall how Christmas can be great and wonderful. Let’s make a celebration for everyone and allow to feel bright moments for those, who haven’t them enough.

Aim

So, what we do? Anonymous Santa’s club is a group of people, who actually makes the world better and brighter. We give people, who cease to believe in a human goodwill, a holiday. Every Christmas we give gifts of those, who almost no one can please. Children who live in an orphanage and children with life-threatening diseases for which all life is struggling for survival. They are so essential to a ray of light that we can give them. That you can give them!

Please just try to imagine how difficult for them to live in this world. Little orphan freezing in the most vivid childhood day, which they took away. Children with cancer are due every Christmas in their lives, because, maybe they wouldn’t see the next one.

As before

We, anonymous Santa Clauses, exists for a several years. We gave gifts to only one orphanage and one hospital every year. Our capabilities, unfortunately, is not limitless. That’s why we have decided to ask you to join the ranks of the anonymous Santa’s club. You can help for those to whom the rest of the world has refused to help.

Adult, even if he is one and he has no one left, can still working at a minimal job. But, unfortunately, many don’t even want it. A small child growing up without parent is a grief. And he has a great desire to change everything, but his capabilities is very much limited. So complex our world.

By the way, we think too hard for those, who are fighting for their lives every day and every hour. For those, who can hear tomorrow a verdict: “You have less, then month. Say goodbye to everyone. Man is unknown world. Child is unknown bright world where there is no suffering and pain. The world can not be just a month. How long is the month in our world? Very, very short.

As has now become

Very soon, the snow falls and the streets filled by Santa Claus, who will greet all with the Christmas. This is a most magical holiday in the year. Let’s donate a piece of happiness and bright holiday for everyone who we can. Let us reach more children, which are so necessary for human love, warmth and care. If we are united, we can! Together we can do everything!

Become anonymous Santa Claus with us!

How you can help in another way


If you would like to participate, but can’t, then tell to anyone about this project, anyone you can! We have so limit time. For all the money, our club will purchase the necessary gifts, toys, and, what isn’t least, medicines and warn clothes!

In the end, I would like to say just one sentence: “Thank you very much and have a Happy Merry Christmas”.

story:
Balkan Children's Judo Tournament - Shkoder, Albania

Our goal is to purchase equipment for an annual Balkan Children's Judo Tournament on April 13, 2013. Judo is a positive sport for children because it promotes self discipline, respect, and self-control. A Balkan Judo tournament is a great opporunity spread this positive message as well as promote cultural exchange and good will in the Balkans.

We held the first Judo For Peace Cup in Shkoder in September 2012. Teams from Croatia, Montengro, Kosovo, and Albania came to compete. In order to hold this tournament we had to borrow equipment from visiting teams. We are holding this fundraising campaign to purchase our own equipment so we can sustainbly hold our own tournaments starting with a Childrens Tournament on April 13, 2013. Our goal is to evenutally host a tournament that includes every Balkan country.

Anton Shkoza was introduced to Judo while on politcal asylum in Greece and Italy from 1990 -1993. When he returned his hometown Vau Dejës, he introduced the art of Judo for the first time in Albania. Since then he has worked relentlessly to promote and improve the sport of Judo in Albania. He is the president of Akademi Albania Judo Kodokan. Edmond Topalli, one of Anton's students in Vau-Dejës, competed in the Bejing Olympics. All of the children in Vau-Dejës are given the opportunity to study Judo for FREE, as long as they show discipline and dedication to the sport and stay away from harmful activities such as smoking.

Corey Rice, is a Community and Organizational Peace Corps Volunteer serving in Vau-Dejës. His main project is to help increase the capacity of Akademi Albania Judo Kodokan. He directed the first national promotional effort of Judo in Albania, Judo For Peace, and helped plan the first Judo for Peace Cup in Shkoder, where teams from Montegro, Kosovo, Croatia, and Albania came to compete.

The Equipment

 

  • Two Electronic tabletop scoreboards - 450 euros x 2 = 900 euros

  • IJF regulations Judo mats - 65 euros x 70 = 4,550 euros

What if we don't reach our goal?

We will purchase as many mats and scoreboards as we can with the money raised. Just like with the Judo For Peace Tournament in September, we will borrow the neccessary equipment from visiting teams so the tournament can still happen. Ideally, we will eventually own all our own equipment so we can sustainably hold our own tournaments.

If we go over our goal, all addtional money raised will go towards the administrative costs of the tournament so we can lower entry fees!

 

The Impact

  • Akademi Albania Judo Kodokan will have the equipment to hold annual international Balkan tournaments.
  • The capacity for Judo in Albania will be increased.
  • The annual Balkan Children's Judo Tournament will promote healthy lifestyles, cultural exchange and goodwill between nations in the Balkans.
  • Akademi Albania Judo Kodokan will have the equipment neccesary to expand and sustain the Judo program in Albania.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Spread the Word! Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, email it to your friends!  We appreciate all your efforts to get the word out there!
  • Help us translate the video into another language. Our goals is to foster international goodwill through Judo. Any help to translate our video and spread the word in additional languages helps us reach this goal!

Edmond Topalli, one of Anton's students in Vau-Dejës, competed in the Bejing Olympics. Corey Rice, is a Community and Organizational Peace Corps Volunteer serving in Vau-Dejës. His main project is to help increase the capacity of Akademi Albania Judo Kodokan. He directed the first national promotional effort of Judo in Albania, Judo For Peace, and helped plan the first Judo for Peace Cup in Shkoder, where teams from Montegro, Kosovo, Croatia, and Albania came to compete.

The Equipment
 


Two Electronic tabletop scoreboards - 450 euros x 2 = 900 euros



IJF regulations Judo mats - 65 euros x 70 = 4,550 euros

What if we don't reach our goal?
We will purchase as many mats and scoreboards as we can with the money raised. Just like with the Judo For Peace Tournament in September, we will borrow the neccessary equipment from visiting teams so the tournament can still happen. Ideally, we will eventually own all our own equipment so we can sustainably hold our own tournaments.
If we go over our goal, all addtional money raised will go towards the administrative costs of the tournament so we can lower entry fees!
 

The Impact

Akademi Albania Judo Kodokan will have the equipment to hold annual international Balkan tournaments.
The capacity for Judo in Albania will be increased.
The annual Balkan Children's Judo Tournament will promote healthy lifestyles, cultural exchange and goodwill between nations in the Balkans.
Akademi Albania Judo Kodokan will have the equipment neccesary to expand and sustain the Judo program in Albania.



Other Ways You Can Help
 

Spread the Word! Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, email it to your friends!  We appreciate all your efforts to get the word out there!
Help us translate the video into another language. Our goals is to foster international goodwill through Judo. Any help to translate our video and spread the word in additional languages helps us reach this goal!

story:
The APoJi Story


Since October 2009, I have been editor of an unusual peace initiative, the core of which is an evolving, collaborative document, entitled, A Peace of Jerusalem. 


Over a course of nine months, we solicited, captured and collated the opinions, brainstorms and aspirations of average, everyday people in more than 20 countries (on several continents) each of whom had concerns about the long- and/or short-term stability of the Middle East.

Between November 5, 2009, and August 7, 2010, dozens of iterations of an emerging text were posted to the blog that still plays host to the initiative’s master document.   


In all, more than 300 people have so far been involved in the process, a few of whom worked on distilling our diverse pool of ideas into a coherent stream of less than 2,000 words – if you don’t include the preamble and postscripts. 

Attention spans being brief in a world so atwitter, we decided to aim for a concise result that could serve, if need be, as an ‘agreement in principle’ – as a ‘way-forward’; perhaps upon which a more textured, final understanding could be built. 


Following the first printing of A Peace of Jerusalem, on December 13, 2010, a copy was delivered to every contributor that provided us with a valid mailing address, but who will otherwise—like all participants in this project—remain anonymous. 



Overall, APoJi has enjoyed a generally positive reception:


A former Canadian UN Ambassador wrote: 

“APoJ(i) is an interesting concept that bears closer examination.”


After reviewing the document, the Canadian Minister of Foreign Affairs wrote: 

“Canada continues to urge the parties to fulfill all of their obligations and resume direct negotiations in pursuit of a comprehensive two-state solution. Canada stands ready to assist the parties in any way, if requested.”


Of course, the document isn’t perfect, but there are a few pending 'clarity' edits that should make it somewhat 'less imperfect'. And, of course, we’re always open to more great ideas!


To review the proposal, just visit http://apoji.ca; and, while you’re there, you can drop us a comment – or request a free, printable PDF version of the 2010 print edition.

Note: The current edit cycle will close May 12, 2011, which coincides with the conclusion of this funding campaign.


The Impact

The Middle East is changing. Let’s try to make it a change for the better. For everyone.

No one needs to be sold on the many benefits that would be derived from any just settlement of the Israel-Palestine dilemma. The main question, with respect to this particular campaign, would seem to be whether a few hundred—or even a few thousand—people could have a substantial impact on such a complex and deeply-rooted problem...


... which begs the question: How many people does it take to change the world? 


The maximum number would now be somewhere around... seven billion. But, examining the history of man, a strong argument can surely be made that the minimum number is one. 


It could even be you! With the right idea... at the right time... who knows? 


Be the one. Make a difference.



What We Need & What You Get

We’re aiming for a target of $30,000 which will allow us to do a longer, high-quality, print run; expand our editorial and contributor base; cover some operational expenses; and send three representatives to the region this July for discussions with key policy makers – as well as engage with regular people on the street. 


Should we fail to reach our funding objective, the initiative will carry on; we’ll just do a shorter print run and send only one or two people. We have been operating since fourth-quarter 2009, thanks to a generous community of supporters and their conceptual, in-kind and financial contributions.


Should we, by some miracle, exceed our target, we would then endeavor to scale up our efforts accordingly.


For the gift of:


  • a good idea, you will receive a copy of the July 2011 Digital Edition of the proposal, as soon as it becomes available (medium-resolution, printable PDF, delivered by email)

  • $5 or more, you will receive a personalized thank you email, plus the Digital Edition

  • $20 or more, you will be mailed a personal letter of thanks, plus the above incentives

  • $50 or more, we’ll send you the 2011 Print Edition of the proposal, plus the above

  • $200 or more, you’ll score a commemorative APoJi T-shirt, plus the above

  • $500 or more, we’ll ship you a special 2011 Hardcover Edition, plus the above

  • $1,000 or more, you will receive additional recognition in the form of a personally-engraved brass and wooden plaque, plus the above
— all funds denominated in $USD

Other Ways You Can Help


Get your people involved:


  • Direct them to this site – to the page you’re on now (www.indiegogo.com/APoJi)

  • Tell them why this project is important to you

  • Work your social media magic; use the easy-share tools provided above

  • Ask IndieGoGo to feature this project on its main page


Pitch in:


  • Visit the main project page (http://apoji.ca) and review the current version of the text; offer some of your own thoughts on the subject; and invite your most optimistic and creative friends to do the same. On second thought, just send them all – some of our best ideas were born of controversy.

  • Submit a short (500-word max.) original essay, poem or reflection on peace; some of these will be incorporated into the July 2011 editions. A special token of appreciation (yet to be decided) will be awarded to authors whose works are selected for inclusion. 

  • Volunteer your time as an English-Hebrew or English-Arabic editor or translator.



We welcome your participation in this earnest effort to help usher in a more tranquil, stable and productive period in Middle East relations.

Sincerely,


S.L.S.

Editor, APoJi

email: periji@apoji.ca

story:
Ema Miroslava Billings

My name is Ema Billings. I am currently an MA Candidate in Conflict Transformation from The Center for Justice and Peacebuilding in Virgina. I'll be leaving for Nigeria at the end of January 2013 to work with with various women's groups, youth, students, religious communities there. My goals include researching psychosocial distress and wellbeing and interfacing strategies in trauma awareness and resilience with the center's existing programs working directly with women and youth in Nigeria.

 photo by NEEDSCI

I have a passion for helping people and building peace in the community. I grew up in Hawaii and the peaceful islands and community spirit influenced me. Justice for all people, peace and harmony are the goals I strive for each and every day.

I believe in kindness and forgiveness, in charity and acceptance of those I am different from; I believe in protecting all children, no matter who they are or where they live; I believe in the wisdom of old people, and that life without hope is empty; I believe in love of ALL people of ALL nations and of All religions......

I'll be working with New Era Educational and Charitable Support Foundation. NEEDCSI is a unique organization whose mission is to build, support and empower teams of youth with capacities to emerge from a life on the streets, drugs and dysfunctional families, to becoming leaders capable of helping themselves and their communities. New Era Educational and Charitable Support Foundation  connects youth, educators and communities and empowers them to transform themselves from recipients of information and resources into valuable, contributing members of their communities.

NEEDSCI WEBSITE

Since 2007, New Era Educational and Charitable Support Foundation has designed and successfully implemented various transformative programs
and projects in Nigeria particularly, and around West Africa. Some of its key programs include: Interfaith Dialogue, Leadership & Peace building.



My recent experience relevant to Internship:

Year

Position

Organisation

2008, 2009 & 2010

Integrated conflict resolution education (CRE) with the Edible School Yard project, a 6000sq ft learning garden: An initiative that focused on teaching children CRE while working the land. For Hawaiian honoring the land is one way, of building peace.

Brigham Young University – Hawaii: David O. McKay Center for Intercultural Understanding

2009

Interned in Israel & the Palestinian Territories working w/both Jewish & Palestine children & coaches from both sides of the divide: help facilitate a conflict resolution program & helped with fundraising. Also volunteered w/Palestinian Day Camps

PeacePlayers International-Middle East Division

2010-current

Worked first as a board member for two years and currently as an advisory board member on various initiatives based on Gandhian principles. Helped organize and execute lectures series at high schools & universities with global peacebuilders such as Arun Gandhi & Ambassador Chowdhury

Gandhi International Institute for Peace

2012

Wrote & taught peace education as conflict resolution & facilitated circle processes focusing on trauma & resilience as an independent study with at risk youth highly traumatized by violence & poverty.

Shenandoah Valley Juvenile Center contracted by the Office of Refugee & Resettlement & the Division of Unaccompanied Children's Services

2012

Project Coordinator working with a team of 6, on a research intuitive focusing on Intersectionality Theory, with 3 groups of women who are survivors of domestic violence.

The Silent Violence Project/ Founder & independent study advisor: Carolyn Stauffer Ph.D.

2012

Human rights activist & community organizer working on immigration initiatives for undocumented immigrants

Virginia Organizing

 

I reuire $10,000 to help to fund my trip to Nigeria for a year - just a little over $800 dollars per month living expenses.

If I do not reach my target in 90 days, I will keep the funds and continue with other fundraising activities until my goal is achieved. I leave for Nigeria on January 30th, 2013.

The Impact

Your contribution will provide valuable support to me while living in Nigeria. Without your contributions, I am unable to support myself financially for a yaer in Nigeria.

Other Ways You Can Help

If my campaign strikes a chord with you remember that even a small contribution helps towards moving peace foward!

And if financial support just isn't possible please make some noise for me of Facebook or with your freinds !

Use the Indiegogo share buttons to tell your friends and family who might be able to help us reach my target.

Thank you ! Ema

"If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other." Mother Theresa

story:
Building a Community of Care and Connection around Social Good

Many young adults have a strong desire to effect change at home and in the world, but find it difficult to engage in meaningful work based on a lack of resources, lack of personal/professional networks, and a lack of available entry-level positions that challenge them to be bold, innovative, and work with others to serve the public good. Connected Potential (CP) aims to enlist the powerful potential of young adults in creating change in their communities and in the world by connecting them with business advisors and professional mentors to get community-driven projects off the ground.

At a time when young adults are increasingly driven to have a personal impact and engage in positive social change, it has become harder than ever for them to find meaningful positions in the workforce. We see Connected Potential as an alternate form of professional development for young adults interested in social good careers. Our network of mentors (we like to call them #Catalysts) offer expert guidance and support to young adults seeking to have a positive social impact as they leave campus and enter their professional lives.

Our impact will be through the young adults we work with (increased leadership skills and professional development opportunities) as well as their communities. By building a community of care and connection around social good, we hope to create opportunities for young adults to engage in meaningful work while addressing contemporary challenges in their communities and beyond.

Young adults have tons of great ideas, but often have difficulty securing funding to support them. Your contribution will help Connected Potential establish an early stage seed fund that will support the fundraising efforts of young adults around the country.

Our Strategy for Funding

We are seeking $10,000 to support the following activities:

  1. Early Stage Seed Fund. 75% of money raised through this campaign will be distributed to young adults engaged in social change work. Each young adult will need to go through our program to qualify for funding, and their project proposal will go through a review process. Small financial awards will be given ($250-$500) to provide matching contributions to their fundraising efforts.
  2. A Series of Tools and Resources. Connected Potential is working to develop an e-book with concise and relatable "How-To" guides for young adults interested in social entrepreneurship and community-based work. We will use a collaborative approach to developing our resources by inviting experts at other national organizations invested in youth participation and innovation to contribute to the text. This ensures the best content and exposes students to a variety of expertise and opportunity.These guides will be released as serial chapters to campus civic centers and career centers across the country. They will provide exciting and valuable content for college students interested in pursuing social good careers, and will help direct young adults to additional resources offered through Connected Potential's website or through other affiliated organizations. 
  3. Campus to Community Innovation Challenge. Connected Potential has applied for a small grant to organize the Campus to Community Innovation Challenge in Washington, DC. The project would bring together campus teams from area colleges and universities to develop community-driven projects. The program includes a speaker series, time spent with hand selected mentors and business advisors, and a culminating community fundraiser where family and friends gather to hear the teams pitch their final concepts and pledge their support. If we receive the grant, $1,500 of funding raised through this campaign will be applied to support the project.

The Vision:

We envision a world where

  • Young adults have access to the opportunity, resources, and connections to realize their goals and improve the world.
  • Professionals have the opportunity to volunteer time in a direct and high-impact way to assist others with social change projects.
  • A community of care and connection around social change is created for young adults and professionals.


Our Catalysts:

Connected Potential Catalysts are hand-selected professionals with proven experience at igniting change and making a difference. Each project submitted to Connected Potential is matched with a business advisor and professional mentor that are best suited for the project’s success. Our catalysts help young adults follow their passion, build leadership and professional skills, and bring positive change to the community through social good projects.

Business Advisors advise on organizational aspects of a community based project: Team building, project management, finding partners and sponsors, and marketing strategy.

Professional Mentors represent all sectors, and advise on areas of professional expertise specific to a social good project.

Our Team:

Eleanor Hall, Executive Director

Eleanor initiated her career in higher education, first working with students one-on-one as an advisor, then working at the national level on higher education policy issues related to student civic engagement and learning for globally responsible citizenship. Her work in this area has connected her with the leadership of a number of colleges, universities, and national organizations dedicated to increasing engagement and agency among students and young adults. Her interest is in engaging young adults in personal and professional development to help them meet their full potential and change the world around them.


National Advisors:

MacArthur Antigua, Director of Alumni Engagement, Public Allies

Khady Mbaye, Founder and CEO of Meet Yourself

April Mendez, VP of Leadership, Interfaith Youth Core

Kate Olsen, VP of Strategic Partnerships, Network for Good

Kelly Granito, Youth Board Liasion. Research Analyst, MDRC


Youth Advisory Board:

Karim Abouelnaga, Founder and CEO, Practice Make Perfect

Aukai King, Finance and Operations

Ryan LeMere, Creative Director, Connected Potential

Victoria Mita, Director, Fundmytravel.com

Letitia Wells, Lead Writer and Director of Storytelling, Connected Potential

Daniela Zanzero, Marketing and Outreach


How You Can Help

We would love it is you could support our campaign! But even if you can't, there are a ton of ways to support our work.

  1. Help us get the word out! Share this campaign through your social networks to help us share our story.
  2. Become a Catalyst! Are you a professional interested in volunteering 1-3 hours of your time to assist with one of our young change agents? Do you know anyone that would make a great mentor to someone just starting out? Please let us know! http://connectedpotential.org/index.php/become-a-mentor                                    
  3. Get in touch! If you want to help, but don't know how yet, e-mail eleanorATconnectedpotential.org and say hello!

Thank you.

We are only ever as good as the community of people that show up to support us. Connected Potential is building a community of care and support for young adults to make it easier to pursue their dreams for social change. Thank you so much for being a part of this movement. We <3 you.

- xo,

THE TEAM

Connected Potential

April Mendez, VP of Leadership, Interfaith Youth Core
Kate Olsen, VP of Strategic Partnerships, Network for Good
Kelly Granito, Youth Board Liasion. Research Analyst, MDRC

Youth Advisory Board:
Karim Abouelnaga, Founder and CEO, Practice Make Perfect
Aukai King, Finance and Operations
Ryan LeMere, Creative Director, Connected Potential
Victoria Mita, Director, Fundmytravel.com
Letitia Wells, Lead Writer and Director of Storytelling, Connected Potential
Daniela Zanzero, Marketing and Outreach



How You Can Help
We would love it is you could support our campaign! But even if you can't, there are a ton of ways to support our work.




Help us get the word out! Share this campaign through your social networks to help us share our story.

Become a Catalyst! Are you a professional interested in volunteering 1-3 hours of your time to assist with one of our young change agents? Do you know anyone that would make a great mentor to someone just starting out? Please let us know! http://connectedpotential.org/index.php/become-a-mentor                                    

Get in touch! If you want to help, but don't know how yet, e-mail eleanorATconnectedpotential.org and say hello!



Thank you.

We are only ever as good as the community of people that show up to support us. Connected Potential is building a community of care and support for young adults to make it easier to pursue their dreams for social change. Thank you so much for being a part of this movement. We <3 you.
- xo,
THE TEAM
Connected Potential

story:
I have an incredible opportunity to learn The A-Life Method with it's creator, Tera Maxwell. This is a modality that covers the gaps in the field of energy medicine to create amazing results with the Law of Attraction. This is a method one can use to clear old energy from someone's body. Over the years we unconsciously take on energy that is not our own, starting with our birth parents, then taking on old generational patterns, and other energy we consciously or unconsciously learn over our lifetime. Generally, this is energy that no longer serves us and often blocks us from moving forward in our lives.

The A-Life Method is not advertised to the public. It is designed specifically for her clients (like me) who have the foundation of experiencing the benefits of the A-Life Method, but want to go deeper to apply the tool daily for themselves and/or to use with their clients.

After a lifetime of struggling and sensing that there was something else that I am meant to do, this is a dream come true. In the past few years, I have been exploring deeper into myself. I remember when I was very young, I knew things. I knew my parents would get divorced when I was barely old enough to understand what that meant. Growing up in a highly dysfunctional family, that part of me was squelched. Decades later, I am finally coming back to who I was born to be.

The bigger picture: All of this is about how I want to help change this train wreck we humans are creating. There are thousands of spiritual workers, shamans, and energy workers all over the world helping to create a shift on  levels far deeper than the political and corporate. This is my bandwagon, it is how I can help. This is what I can contribute to the bigger picture.

As this one time opportunity came up suddenly, and I am not prepared financially. I decided to run a campaign to raise the funds and announce the news about what I am creating in my life to help others and myself. I am deeply excited about this training! 

You can buy one of my offers or you can donate money in various increments. I appreciate all of your support from the bottom of my heart. Now on with this new adventure!!!!

story:
MakeTronix Alarm is a perfect way of teaching programming in a workshop or school classroom as it comes fully assembled ready to plug in to a Raspberry Pi, and the library, resources and code examples make it easy to teach programming concepts. If you are a school or event that needs 10 or more, please contact us so we can organise a deal.

 

Who are we?

At just 16 years old, Zach is a Raspberry Pi enthusiast. He co-runs the Covent Garden Raspberry Jams, gives talks at events, runs workshops for people of all ages, builds and demonstrates awesome robotics projects and created PiPiano.

Jake is a 17 year old back & front end web expert who has worked with a variety of individuals and businesses.

Together, we aim to create build-it-yourself electronic devices to help people understand the technological world we live in and contribute to it. This is why we started MakeTronix.

The story of MakeTronix Alarm

We were approached by a 10 year old boy attempting to learn programming with a Raspberry Pi, and asking how he could build a bedroom alarm with a Pi. We set about helping him learn the required programming and get the required components, and discovered how quickly he picked up programming and had a fully functioning alarm. Now he's hard at work, integrating motion detecting cameras and social media integration and he now wants to build a private website for his home's security!

We decided this would make a fantastic educational tool and came up with the MakeTronix Alarm. It is a fully-assembled circuit board with a motion sensor, keypad, LED and sounder, that sits on top of the Raspberry Pi, enabling anyone to build their own alarm in minutes. It comes with a software library that makes it easy to talk to the circuit board from Python, lots of examples, tutorials and lesson plans to get you started with Python programming and building your own alarm. This makes it perfect for individuals who want to learn how technology works, how to program and how to build an awesome, DIY customisable internet-connected alarm with a Raspberry Pi, as well as a tool for teachers to teach programming in an exciting, interactive, practical and engaging way.

What is it?

MakeTronix Alarm is a fully-assembled circuit board that sits on top of your Pi with a keypad, light, sounder and motion sensor. This makes it easy to build an alarm with our tutorials, educational resources and lesson plans. It’s also great for integration with other projects that require you to input a numerical code, detect motion, flash an LED or make some noise. The sky is the limit with MakeTronix Alarm!

NOTE: This is an educational product. Please use commercially available alarms to ensure the security of your property. We cannot take any responsibility for the security of your property.

What can you do with it?

MakeTronix Alarm is a fantastic means of learning the basics of programming, learning how code works, how circuit boards work, how electronics can be integrated in the world and is a portal into the world of the Internet of Things.

Our tutorials and lesson plans take you or your classroom through setting up a Raspberry Pi, flashing a light, making some noise, reading the keypad, detecting motion and making an alarm. This provides a good grounding for the world of computer science and programming. With this knowledge and equipment, you can go on to build other exciting projects.

MakeTronix Alarm could become an internet-controlled, intelligent, home-made, DIY alarm with cameras, a website, social network integration and more!

Why Indiegogo?

As we are young, we haven't got the money to start up our company, MakeTronix, and we would like to ensure that we don't go into production without a good number of sales. We want to be able to eventually start up our own company and continue getting MakeTronix Alarms and other products into the hands of schools and children worldwide. To do this, we need to raise as much as we can with this campaign. By buying a MakeTronix Alarm in this campaign, not only are you receiving a cool little circuit board perfect for learning programming, but you are helping to make a website, lessons plans, resources and a platform for schools to begin to teach programming.

As Zach is very involved with the Raspberry Pi community, attending, running and speaking at events, he has spoken to a variety of people from professional programmers to educators who have all given their support

Jake has also been speaking to schools and young people, who gave him the green light.

What do you get?

You will receive a fully assembled circuit board so within minutes, you can just place your MakeTronix Alarm onto your Pi and get learning, hacking and programming!

We have gone through multiple prototypes and are now happy with the design and functionality of the board. MakeTronix Alarm will be manufactured and assembled in China and your pledges will support our production costs.  Zach has already liaised with the company to ensure we can offer fully-assembled, safe, circuit boards, ready for schools & homes, for the best price.

We have an experienced business partner, Ryanteck, who have themselves made multiple Raspberry Pi add-on boards and educational electronic products, working with us on this project. They have helped in the prototyping and will provide fulfilment for the boards (postage and packaging).

Note: You will need an internet connected Raspberry Pi with keyboard, mouse and screen in order to use MakeTronix Alarm.

Which pledge level do I choose?

Please select whether you want just one MakeTronix Alarm for yourself or a pair. Please select the appropriate delivery option (UK, EU or International).

Please note: We will not ship your pledge unless the correct amount of shipping has been applied.

Documentation & Examples

Our GitHub repository is available here: https://github.com/MakeTronix/Examples

Here you can find a set of examples and a Python library that makes it easy to get started and control your MakeTronix Alarm. These examples will be converted into tutorials and lesson plans on our website.

Risks

Work overload - to avoid schoolwork interfering or getting too many orders, Zachary Igielman and Jake Blumenow are not shipping the products. The boards will by assembled by Sunsoar and shipped to you by Ryanteck.

Manufacturing issues - we have gone through multiple prototypes including a fully assembled prototype from Sunsoar to ensure the designs all work as expected.

Hardware compatibility issue - we have tested with the original Pi, Rev 2, A+, B+, Pi 2 and Pi 3.

Unexpected costs - we have a small amount of wiggle room in our calculations to ensure we can cover any unexpected charges or issues.

Credits & Thanks

Amy Mather for designing our logo.

Michael Horne for helping us with the product and campaign.

Ryan and Coco, our business partners.

Note: Your personal information (order and shipping address) will be shared with our business partner, Ryanteck LTD, who are carrying out fulfillment of the kits.

story:
Hi ABUNDANT ANGELS!!!!!!

I am a graduate student almost finished with my two year masters program in Spiritual Psychology at the University of Santa Monica. www.universityofsantamonica.edu

What is Spiritual Psychology?

Right now, more than any time in history, people are evaluating their lives through the filter of these essential questions:

1) Who Am I? 
2) What is My Purpose? 
3) How Can I Make a Meaningful Contribution in the World?

For over 30 years, the University of Santa Monica, the Worldwide Center for the Study and Practice of Spiritual Psychology®, has been diligently and lovingly providing innovative Master's Degree Programs in Spiritual Psychology. The University's Soul-Centered experiential educational paradigm evokes in students their own answers to these three essential questions resulting in more purposeful and fulfilling lives. Each individual student is recognized, honored, and respected for the Essence of who they truly are.

Spiritual Psychology is the study and practice of the art and science of human evolution in consciousness. In order to fulfill this quest, we must begin by distinguishing the essence of human evolution—what does it mean to evolve? In short, it means surrendering anything in consciousness that disturbs one’s peace. It also means sacrificing our illusions of separation in service to the deeper revelation of who we truly are as Loving, Peaceful, Compassionate and Joyful beings. We refer to this level of awareness as the Authentic Self.

Over the course of two years a class of over 200 students came together and began this incredible journey to the authentic Self. My intention in participating in this program was to more effectively take on the challenge that Gandhi's famous quote implies; Be the change you wish to see in the world.

I want to see a world where everyone wins. Where there truly is enough for all. 

I know that every dollar you give to support these students to completion will be such an affirmation towards this vision. 

ONE FOR ALL AND ALL FOR ONE

JOIN US IN THIS COMMITMENT!!!!

Your donation will help us all graduate together by helping students that are short for the praticum expenses. Praticum costs are 3800.00 per student. There are aprox 12 students who are needing partial funds for praticum.

If we raise more than what we need it is our intention to donate the extra funds to the class of 2013 Spirit Walk fund and continue our legacy of giving!

Praticum is a 5 day transformational retreat in August that is the cumulation of the Masters Program. 

Once completed we will all be qualified to graduate in August!!!!

One of the primary ongoing intentions at USM is to foster and nurture a culture of giving. Such a culture begins with the understanding that giving and receiving are part of the circular flow of loving, caring, and sharing that are essential to the University’s Soul-Centered educational process. 

I deeply believe in the benefits the masters program has made in my life and in the lives of my classmates. It has been a rigorous program that takes deep courage and commitment to ones Self to Master. Many of our fellow classmates dropped out along the way for many reasons some of them being financial. It is a challenge to meet the demands of a full time job and this program. I am watching so many people transform their lives. In other cultures there are ashrams where people could go away from the cares of the material "world" and embark upon a deep transformational experience. These people enriched the world for us all with the wisdom they shared.

USM is unique in that it's very structure it supports integration with the world around us, so that when we complete the program we will be prepared to BE the CHANGE we WISH to Be in the world and in our lives. 

It’s just too close to call as to who derives more value, those who are “giving” or those who are “receiving.”

Now for the FUN PART!!!!!!!

An aspect of the masters program was to create a second year project that had a deep and profound meaning for each student.

Many have evolved their soul purposes through this process and they are sharing their gifts with all of you who donate. Most of the class has donated their special gift to this cause truly creating a "barn raising" or "rent party" vibe. We are all in it together and we invite you to join us!!!!!!

If we do not reach our full goal all funds we raise will be used to help the most people possible make it to praticum. Each student is pursuing their own fundraising goals as well and we are certain that we will meet our objective though all of our fund raising efforts!!!!

It's not only about money! We can use your good thoughts and support. Send this out to your network of friends!!!! Use the indiegogo share tools!!!

All support is welcome!!!!

story:
Love Dall Saag at a 2?

Then you probably know and love Sunayana Palikhe, John & Rama's niece, as the lovely waitress at Indian American Cafe for the last two years. But, did you know that she is studying pre-dentistry? That she was a hygienist in Nepal? That her dream is to educate Nepali children about oral hygiene and create free cleaning clinics? 

Sunayana is beautiful, inside and out. And to help her achieve part of her dreams, she has entered Miss Nepal US, to be held on August 17, 2013 in New York City. If she wins, she will be flown to Nepal and be given the opportunity and means to expand clinics and education in a country so desperately lacking these resources. 

What can you do to help?

1- Contribute to this campaign!
and/or
2- Send this link to anyone you think could help!

If you contribute, your funds will pay for several things:
-Sunayana's travel expenses to New York (approximately $500)
-Clothing for the competition itself (approximately $500)
-A week-long mandatory training session including room and board ($1000)
-Extra monies will go directly to charities supporting oral health in Nepal 

What's in it for you?

Sponsors of $200 or more will have their business or organization advertised at the Miss Nepal US competition in televised broadcasts and mentioned in printed materials as well as their website. They have over two dozen media partners!

For those of us who don't have quite so much to offer, we can still make a difference with a few bucks here and there. Any amount will help Sunayana pay for this trip. 

If you have ever gone to Indian American Cafe and she has made your dining experience enjoyable as your waitress, then consider this an extra $5-50 tip! She's worth it! Sunayana loves living here in Harrisonburg and wants very much to represent our community in this special endeavor.

If you are not able to contribute, please SHARE this campaign with your friends and family- a little goes a long way!

story:
Summary

Finnish Studies at the University of Toronto needs your help.  To meet our obligations during 2015-2016, the Canadian Friends of Finland Education Foundation (CFFEF), founded in 1990 in support of Finnish Studies at UofT, now needs to raise a minimum of $25,000 

You can help by (1) sending in a donation, (2) spreading the word and the link to your friends and acquaintances. 

As a donor you can give any amount: $10, $25, $50, $100, $200, $500 or more! 

Canadian donors of $25 or more will receive tax receipts, so please include your name and address with your donation.

Who Are We?

CFFEF’s mission is to raise funds for Finnish Studies at the University of Toronto, where the Finnish Studies Program was established in 1989. In multicultural Canada it is essential to teach Finnish Studies at the university level. A partnership was formed between Canada’s leading University, the University of Toronto, and the Government of Finland. The Finnish Studies Program has ever since taught courses in Finnish language, Finnish literature, Finnish folklore, Finnish and Scandinavian cinema and Finnish Canadian Immigrant Experience.

Our first professors were Börje Vähämäki (1989-2009, 2013-2014) and Pia Päiviö (2009-2013). The current professor, Anu Muhonen (2014- ) is a dynamic teacher and cutting-edge researcher. The program in Toronto is of top quality and is the largest in North America; to-date more than 1300 students have benefitted from our Finnish Studies courses in numerous ways. Many have had life-changing experiences; some have chosen to major in Finnish Studies.

Finland’s Ambassadors to Canada consistently praise our program as a significant component of Finland-Canada relations as evidenced by the fact that no less than two Presidents of Finland, Mauno Koivisto (1990) and Sauli Niinistö (2014) have visited our Finnish Studies Program on official state visits to Canada.

The Goal for 2015-16 is $25,000.

How Can You Help?

We ask you to do two things: (1) Send a donation (2) Spread the word to your friends and acquaintances.

You as a Donor. You can give $10, $25, $50, $100, $200, $500 or more – any amount is welcome. Donors of $25 and above qualify for a Canadian tax receipt. Please supply name and address.

Every Dollar that You Donate Will Be Matched - Twice. Two individuals, so-called “matching donors”, have pledged to match your donation, dollar for dollar, each up to a total of $25,000. This triples the value of your donation. For example, if you give $100, CFFEF will ultimately receive $300, and if you donate $500 we get $1500. Matching gifts inspire others. The total yield following this campaign may reach $75,000. This then leaves funds for subsequent years and gives us time to secure funds in the future.

The Launch. This campaign will be launched on November 15, 2015 and close on December 15.

Why Now?

The official partnership between Finland and the University of Toronto changed in 2014, when Finland’s government was forced to significantly reduce their support for Finnish Studies programs abroad. Until then Finland had paid half of the cost of our Finnish Program. Hence the urgent short term need therefore is $25,000.

Why Does the Program Need to Be Preserved?

The Finnish Studies Program serves Finnish Canadians, and Canadians of all backgrounds on several levels:

  1. The Finnish Studies Program represents an impactful and worthy legacy of Finns in Canada;
  2. Finnish Studies is an academic program of national and international significance;
  3. Finnish Studies is an increasingly important link in the cultural, educational, and economic relations between Finland and Canada;
  4. Despite its smallness the Finnish Studies Program is “a precious piece of the global mosaic.”

Impact

The Finnish Studies Program enriches the students’ lives, many with life-changing impact. Finland and Canada share in common the fact that they both

  • Are northern countries with Arctic concerns;
  • Are bilingual nations;
  • Have large and powerful neighbours;
  • Have strong democratic traditions and share similarities in social fabric and attitudes.

Yet Finland, its people, and its culture are unique:

  • The Finnish language is unrelated to all Indo-European languages.
  • Geographically Finland is and has always been between East and West, experiencing conflicts and challenges throughout its history.
Finland’s uniqueness makes it extra interesting and worth learning about.

 

Watch the "extended version" video: 

Interested in hearing more of what our current and former students had to say about the Finnish Studies program? Click this link to view a longer version of the interviews that were conducted for the official campaign video:
https://youtu.be/nsyQsNvgGto
 
 Contribute now

To donate, please click the "Contribute Now" button on this page. You will be presented with a page where you can specify the amount of your donation and choose whether to pay with a credit card or with PayPal.

To get a donation receipt, choose the "perk"

If you are donating $25 or more in Canada and you would like a donation receipt for income tax purposes, we'll need your full name and mailing address. (If you already donated and didn't choose the perk option, don't worry, we'll email you to ask you for this information.)

To make it easier for you to include your mailing information with your donation, we created a "Perk" option in this campaign. Here's how it works:

1. To contribute to this campaign, click the "Select a Perk" link. This brings you to a new page showing that you have selected a donation of $25 (the minimum required to receive a donation receipt).

2. To donate more than $25, click the "Custom" box found under "Additional Gift", and enter the additional amount that you wish to donate. For example, if you want to donate a total of $100, click Custom and enter the amount of $75. Your total contribution amount ($25 + $75 = $100) will be shown at the bottom of the page.

3. Next, enter your name and mailing address in the "Shipping information" area. These are required fields.

If you have any questions about this process, please contact us by clicking the pink "Contact" link underneath the video at the top of this page.

Thank you for your support!

Summary 
Finnish Studies at the University of Toronto needs your help.  To meet our obligations during 2015-2016, the Canadian Friends of Finland Education Foundation (CFFEF), founded in 1990 in support of Finnish Studies at UofT, now needs to raise a minimum of $25,000 
You can help by (1) sending in a donation, (2) spreading the word and the link to your friends and acquaintances. 
As a donor you can give any amount: $10, $25, $50, $100, $200, $500 or more! 
Canadian donors of $25 or more will receive tax receipts, so please include your name and address with your donation.
   Who Are We? 
CFFEF’s mission is to raise
funds for Finnish Studies at the University of Toronto, where the Finnish
Studies Program was established in 1989. In multicultural Canada it is
essential to teach Finnish Studies at the university level. A partnership was
formed between Canada’s leading University, the University of Toronto, and the
Government of Finland. The Finnish Studies Program has ever since taught
courses in Finnish language, Finnish literature, Finnish folklore, Finnish and
Scandinavian cinema and Finnish Canadian Immigrant Experience. 
Our first professors were Börje Vähämäki (1989-2009, 2013-2014) and Pia Päiviö (2009-2013). The current professor, Anu Muhonen (2014- ) is a dynamic teacher and cutting-edge researcher.
The program in Toronto is of top quality and is the largest in North America; to-date
more than 1300 students have benefitted from our Finnish Studies courses in
numerous ways. Many have had life-changing experiences; some have chosen to
major in Finnish Studies.
Finland’s Ambassadors to Canada consistently
praise our program as a significant component of Finland-Canada relations as
evidenced by the fact that no less than two Presidents of
Finland, Mauno Koivisto (1990) and Sauli Niinistö (2014) have visited our
Finnish Studies Program on official
state visits to Canada. 
The Goal for 2015-16 is $25,000.

We ask you to do two things: (1) Send
a donation (2) Spread the word to your friends and acquaintances.

story:
Update

Please check out the "updates" tab above. We will keep you all informed as we make progress. :)

_________________________________________


Short Summary


The idea here is simple: we'd like to create a new community for refugees from Anime-Forums.com while also building and expanding to become a sprawling online community of our own. We will achieve sustainability through a mixture of ad revenue and user donations, making upgrades and expanding based on user needs and not to make a profit. No fuss, no muss, just a user-driven community where people can feel safe to talk about anime, manga, gaming, cartoons, TV shows, comics -- all the staples of a thriving online geek culture.

Why "Sakuga" city? Sakuga refers to the process of creating animation for anime, and is most often used to denote the moment when the animation quality suddenly spikes for a particularly important scene. It's a word closely associated with the craft of anime, and we felt it was a good way to get our fandom across.

But we wanted to make sure that other geeks felt welcome, too. So, we made our community a "city", a collection of different people with different interests -- just with a distinctly anime vibe.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get off the ground, SakugaCity will need 3 main components.

  1. A domain name (already acquired!)
  2. Forum software license.
  3. Server hosting.
Anime-Forums.com, the forum which the developers of this project came from, ran on vBulletin, which felt restrictive and archaic. Instead, we'll be going with XenForo software, developed by former vBulletin programmers who felt the same way. It's expandable, friendly to new visual themes and add-ons, and offers support for a year with a new license purchase. As for hosting, we'll begin the forum's life on GoDaddy's servers and expand as needed.

If we can get the money together to get all these things we'll have a basic forum up and ready to go within a week of a successful funding campaign. It'll be bare bones (unless we reach some stretch goals) but it will function and will be updated and maintained by a crew of dedicated former administrators, moderators, and regular users from A4. If we manage to exceed our goal we can get other fancy stuff like forum add-ons, a custom skin or two, and more.

What do you get out of this? A fancy new place to call home with staff who actually care about the forum's future and who will not be afraid to try new things, and who will do everything in their power to ensure the forums are welcoming, safe, and functional. 

Risks & Challenges

Forums do not make money. This has been a harsh lesson to learn but a valuable one. Even with ads, the revenue generated by forums has always been insufficient for sustaining themselves without resorting to shady business, the kind we have no taste for and will never resort to.

The good news is that a successful funding campaign basically guarantees that SakugaCity will be able to run for an entire year without any additional funding, able to sustain a small to moderate population. We'll also have a Patreon running after the campaign wraps up, allowing users to donate to the forum to cover additional costs and pay for shiny new things like additional forum themes, art assets, and other goodies. Patrons will also get perks as a thank you for their continued support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position where you can help financially, you can help us by getting the word out to old A4 members you knew who might be interested in having a new place to call home. Word-of-mouth can be very powerful, and once successfully funded having more people around is always better than less.

story:
We're providing instruments to students in a music program facing budget cuts. If we don't act now, the program will be cut. 

We're raising funds for the music program at University Heights High School, an inner-city school in the Bronx in New York City. Many of its students live in poverty and face a great deal of obstacles, from transient housing and abject living conditions to health and environment risks and safety concerns. And very recently, the school's music department, a vital resource in inspiring character and discipline (and joy!) to students, experienced severe budget cuts. The result? The entire music education department is about to be cut altogether—but we're doing our best to not let that happen.

The school was recently featured and reported in the New York Times as being located in the poorest congressional district in the country.

BLACKSOCKS, a socks-company-with-a-conscience in Manhattan, heard about the budget cuts and decided to organize this effort. We're raising $5,000 that will be used to provide instruments and supplies to students, most of whom have not had any exposure to music education prior to attending the school. This amount will significantly help the district and ensure that the program stays alive going into next school year. 

Our company is the inventor of the sockscription—an innovative online subscription service—and we're always looking for ways to foster people's creativity and self-expression. After hearing of this dire situation, BLACKSOCKS made a commitment to help these young, motivated and talented scholars continue making music. 

Please spread the word by sharing on Facebook and Twitter. Also be sure to use our hashtag #SaveBronxMusic. Thank you for reading. We look forward to your support!

Risks and challenges

The risks in this project are minimal. If we raise the funds, the music program stays alive through next year. If we don't, there's a strong chance the school will have to cut the department from its curriculum.

story: After a series of budget cuts, the magazine and yearbook of South Lake High School were combined into one class. Now, we're teaming up to raise money in order to keep our publications alive. With your donations we want to produce an award winning yearbook. We also plan to release the biggest edition of the Lancer in history! But we can't do it alone. Donate now to support the South Lake Publications team!

story:
Hello Friends!

 I have recently been accepted to a prestigious music course called Prussia Cove International Musicians' Seminar. The age limit is 30 so I wasn't surprised when I didn't get in last year. I thought to myself, 'okay no problem, I have  9 more go's. This year, I wasn't going to apply because I thought I wouldn't get in again but then I thought if I didn't apply then I would definitely not get in so I did with not much expectation... and I got in! 

 I am thrilled but there is one problem: I have no money to attend the course. I didn't really think this would ever become a problem because as I said, I wasn't expecting to get in in the first place! My parents, who have never been a very big fan of me being a musician, have always said that I would be on my own after graduation and so I am not in a situation where I can ask them for money. Nor do I have a sponsor who I can ask. I teach but that barely gets me through living in London. So here I am, turning to the support of my friends. 

 The course will take place in a secluded beautiful setting in Cornwall. I was accepted into the class of Ferenc Rados (who taught Andras Schiff) and Rita Wagner. They are both amazing musicians and I can even sit in other teachers' classes, such as Steven Isserlis and Gehrard Schulz. I will get the chance to meet and play with other musicians from around the globe.

 So now I need to raise £1000 to attend this ten day course. This will be an amazing opportunity for me to grow as a musician and I aim to share and pass on everything I learn at Prussia Cove with those around me, may that be in the form of performance, chamber music or teaching. 


Thank you so much in advance!

With lots of love,

Sunny

story:
22nd Annual West Seattle 4th of July Kids Parade

The West Seattle Children's Parade has been a staple of West Seattle for 22 years and this year FIT4MOM West Seattle is spearheading the effort to keep this wonderful, family-friendly event thriving in our community.  With close to 1,000 people in attendance, we would like to continue celebrating the 4th of July with this annual event for West Seattle families. 

In 2014, Red Tricycle featured our West Seattle parade in their national roundup of best 4th of July parades across the country!

Show up and you're in the parade!  Old fashioned gunny sack races at Hamilton ViewPoint Park after the parade.  This is the very best way to start your Fourth of July celebration!  All proceeds will help us take care of the permits and insurance we need to put on this amazing event.  No donation is too small! 

Please help us cover the expenses of this wonderful tradition and help us celebrate the 4th of July in our West Seattle small town way.  Together we can do it!

Any amount raised above and beyond our 2016 goal ($1,200 is just the start to cover the costs) will be used for the 2017 parade.  Thank you for supporting the parade.  Our West Seattle community is amazing!

story:
Short Summary

I am a 25 yearold self employed IT consultant from New Plymouth, New Zealand. I am wanting to help a close friend finish his first year of University. He has been through a series of unfortunate circumstances that have rendered him unable to afford the last half of his accomodation for the year. If we cannot raise the funds, he will ultimately have to drop out of his accomodation, and ultimately his University studies - which is something I, and many others would hate to see happen.

What We Need 

I want to try online fundraising as a means of trying to make a positive difference in the tertiary education time of his life. I am seeking around $3000 in order to pay the accomodation apportionment of his first year at Victoria University, Wellington NZ. His student loan is enough to cover his studies, but not enough for the accomodation. 

If we don't reach target the money will still be put into a collective fund with other money raised from other means of fundraising.

The Impact

As he is a student with no continuous income, banks have declined any form of loan as well. It is so hard seeing him go through the fear of being left with nothing when the bill payment date comes toward the end of August. You can help make a difference in his life by contributing to the cause and enabling him to continue his tertiary studies for this year, and hopefully allowing him to continue his study in coming years. It is important that he can still stay in his Hall of Residence that he has spent the first half of the year in, with supportive friends. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out, share with your friends and family. I will be starting the process with a donation of my own into the fund. If we could get 30 people to donate $100 each it would be incredible!!!
